In this route, since the number of young male characters in the Super Mario Bros. series is lax, the first few options will feature a couple of the male characters that does appear in the series, including the younger versions of the Mario characters appearing in the Yoshi series (i.e. Baby Mario, Baby Luigi, Baby Bowser, etc.), Bowser Jr. and a few of the Koopalings (i.e. Lemmy and Iggy), and the characters appearing the Paper Mario series (i.e. Twink, Goombario, Koops, etc.)

The fourth route will features Original Characters Slots open for anyone who wish to create their own original character to be placed in the Super Mario Bros. series.

The only question is, which route will you choose?

Baby Mario characters

Bowser Jr. and the Koopalings

Paper Mario characters

-or-

Original Character Slots
15311.title: Super Mario Bros. series

153114.content:
The character is an original character and non-canon to the Super Mario series.

Choose one of the slots you want to focus on...

The Tiny Relative of Princess Peach: The boy is a prince who is a blood relative to Princess Peach and often stays with her at her castle. Because of the young prince's cuteness, he is often toyed around and the mercy of the whims of Peach and her friends, Toadette, Princess Daisy, Rosalina, and Pauline. Similar to how Princess Peach is often kidnapped by Bowser, the young prince is often kidnapped by a female villain such as Wendy O. Koopa or Super Mario enemies wearing the Super Crown (i.e. Bowsette, Booette, Chompette, etc.).

The Tiny Toad: A young Toad is accidentally exposed to the Mini Mushroom, and as a result, he is shrunken down to tiny size. He is accidentally shipped with a container full of vegetables to the home of a major female character who plans on eating them for her meal. At his size, the boy must avoid being squashed under the giantesses' feet, or he must explore the inside of the giantesses' bodies should he gets eaten. The latter is similar to Bowser's Inside Story, except more feminine.

-or-

The Princess from a Giant Land: A princess from the Tiny-Huge Kingdom goes to the Mushroom Kingdom for vacation and befriends a young, lonely male character after an accidental encounter. The princess either establishes a new base in the Mushroom Kingdom to be closer to the boy, or she takes him back to her kingdom. (A/N: The young male character can either be canon or non-canon. You are also free to use any of the previous original characters in this route.)
153114.title: Original Character Slots

1531141.content:
Character Bios:

(Original character by ButterBazooka)

Name: Prince Lemon
Age: 7 years old
Eyes: Blue
Hair: Blonde
Height: 3"
Weight: 2.5 grams
Ethnicity: White/Caucasian
Backstory: Prince Lemon is the relative of Mushroom Kingdom's Princess Peach, born tiny and constantly under her constant supervision at the castle. Because of the young prince's innocence and cuteness, he is often toyed with by Peach and her friends, Toadette, Princess Daisy, Rosalina, and Pauline. Similar to how Princess Peach is often kidnapped by Bowser, the young prince is often kidnapped by a female villain such as Wendy O. Koopa or Super Mario enemies wearing the Super Crown (i.e. Bowsette, Booette, Chompette, etc.).

Main Story:

The sun shone over the green and vibrant Mushroom Kingdom. Its warm and bright radiance cast the elegant glow over Princess Peach's Castle, home to the eponymous crown princess who rules over the Mushroom Kingdom with grace and elegance. Though the windows were covered by curtains, the sunlight still shone through the fabric inside the royal bedroom, brightening up the entire room.

This slight shift in brightness allowed the occupant sleeping in the bedroom to flutter her eyes open, and slowly sit up with a yawn and a stretch. With a large, content sigh, she looked into her half-exposed bosom, gently reached two pinching fingers deep insider her cleavage, and pulled out a certain seven year-old human boy with short blonde hair.

"Wakey, wakey, Lemon. It's time to wake up," Peach cooed as she brought the tiny boy to her pursed lips and kissed him.

Despite being named after the sour fruit, Prince Lemon was a sweet and gentle boy made all the more sweeter from his upbringing courtesy of his relative, Peach. He was often curious, but he loved the people in his life, especially the women who loved him back and enjoyed playing with him. Unlike the boys his age, Prince Lemon enjoyed tea parties, shopping, and attempting to apply beauty makeup on the giantesses who babysat him. He was especially fond of being cuddled and held by the giant girls; it was easier on the nerves this way.

Lemon rubbed his eyes and yawned, waking up to the sight of his goddess of a guardian smiling down with her signature plush lips. "Good morning..."

1.) "...mama." (Prince Lemon was born from the lonely Princess Peach wishing to the Star Spirits for a child, so the Star Spirits infused a part of her hair into special glowing flower bud, and the flower bloomed to reveal her son. Today, she's meeting with the dignitaries from the other Kingdoms, so Toadette will be babysitting him.)

2.) "...big sister." (Prince Lemon was born a tiny human lost in the Mushroom Kingdom, but he was found by Peach during a pleasant picnic and was adopted not long after. Peach often teases Lemon like any older sister teased their little brothers, but Lemon didn't mind the teasing at all. Today, she's invited her friends, Daisy, Rosalina, and Pauline for a get together, and Peach has something mischievous planned for Lemon.)

3.) "...auntie." (Prince Lemon is the son of the Princess from the Tiny-Huge Lands who was met with an unfortunate fate by being swallowed by a giant fish at sea. With no sign of her return, Prince Lemon was taken in by his mother's dear friend, Princess Peach, who dearly loved playing with her surrogate nephew. Today, anything can happen, including Peach and Lemon getting kidnapped by Bowsette or Wendy O. Koopa.)
1531141.title: The Tiny Relative of Princess Peach

15311412.content:
"Good morning, big sister."

Princess Peach couldn't help but gush over how adorable her adopted little brother was while waking up. She quickly planted two more kisses to his little body, and one more for good measure. "Sorry, but you were just so cute waking up that I just couldn't resist," Peach apologized. "Come on, let's get dressed and ready for breakfast."

Peach gently brought him over to her changing station where they got dressed in their attire and ready for the day. While Peach dressed up in her signature pink-colored ball gown and crown, Prince Lemon was dressed up in a yellow-colored uniform to compliment the fruit he was named after, and wore a small crown on top of his head. It wasn't embedded with a jewel, but it nevertheless showcased his royal status.

As Lemon was fully dressed for the day, a white-gloved hand suddenly pinched the back of his uniform. The tiny boy yelped as Peach lifted him up to her bosom and pressed him into her cleavage, squeezing him between her massive breasts. "Hey, big sis, what are you doing!?" Lemon yelled as he struggled against Peach's boobs.

"What? I'm just trying to make lemonade," Peach teased, jiggling her massive mammaries and burying the boy deeper inside her cleavage.
"After all, what's lemonade without a freshly-pressed Lemon?"

"Sis, stop! We're gonna be late for breakfast!" Lemon whined, muffled by Peach's breast flesh.

"Don't worry, Lemon, I'll carry you there this way," Peach assured with a little giggle, pulling up her white frilly shirt over her exposed cleavage and carrying him while she exited the bedroom and walked down the hallway. "Oh, and just so you know, we're not gonna eat breakfast alone. The girls are going to be joining us for breakfast shortly and then we're going out for a day on the town."

At the mention of those names, Peach felt a struggling tickle inside her breasts. She held in her urge to laugh out loud as Lemon's little hands tickled her boobs trying to crawl out. He popped out of the top of the white shirt with a gasp. "Daisy, Rosie, and Pauline's coming over too!? Why didn't you tell me this before!?"

"I just wanted it to be a surprise, so... surprise!"

Lemon whined while the giantess giggled at his reaction. "Why do you keep doing this to me, sis?"

"Because, isn't it a big sister's job to tease her little brother?" Peach asked rhetorically as an answer.

Lemon only sighed as an appropriate response.

The title of big sister was something Peach took both lightly and lovingly since the day Peach discovered Lemon when he was just a lost little human who wandered into the castle grounds, avoiding the Toad guards and scavenging for food from the bushes. It was around the early afternoon, and Peach and her friends having a delightful picnic in the castle's backyard area.

Peach, Daisy, Rosalina, and Pauline were all enjoying a lovely gathering and gossip over delectable food, tea, and coffee. Unbeknownst to them at the moment, the lost and hungry tiny boy of six years was scavenging for apples to eat from the bushes when he saw the delicious food laid out on the plaid picnic blanket. Out of all the food spread out, the one that got his attention was the cake Peach made herself. He snuck up to the cake while Peach's back was turned and tried to take a chunk of the delicious baked goods. As he went for a few big mouthfuls, Peach sliced off a parts of the cake and handed them to her friends, while she took the one with Lemon in it, burying him inside it.

As Peach scooped a portion of the cake slice with Lemon buried inside, the tiny boy popped out and screamed as he was headed into a giant mouth, a big pink maw outfitted with large, chomping, chopping teeth, and glistening with coats of saliva. Fortunately, that scream was all it took for Lemon to grab Peach's attention, as well as Daisy, Rosalina, and Pauline for all to see. He was understandably afraid at first, seeing he was almost eaten by the giant princess of the Mushroom Kingdom, but he was gently shushed and comforted by Peach. Lemon felt at ease under the blonde giantess's gentle touch and remained by her side throughout the rest of the day.

Since then, Peach adopted him and raised him as her little brother. She explained she loved her Toads as her own children, and Lemon was young enough to be her little brother. Despite using the Super Mushroom, Lemon's size didn't grow one bit. That was okay because Lemon was cuter this way. He was so cute, that Peach's sisterly instincts began to tease Lemon, constantly placing him in her breasts,
pretending to eat him, and laying with him with her feet. She also enabled her friends to lovingly tease him too, eventually making the young prince a target for their affection and personal desire for their whims.

Thanks to Lemon's innocence, the young prince didn't catch on to their own brand of playfulness. He didn't mind being playing with them, it was a nice pace from being teased by Peach.

The two siblings entered the patio where a large round table sat outside, set and ready for their arrival, plus their friends. The table featured a miniature table so that Lemon could eat alongside Peach. The table was loaded with a most delicious sight. There were plates of pancakes, berries, and syrup assembled on one portion of the dining table, plates full of protein breakfasts like bacon, sausages, and eggs cooked in all different kinds, and a few plates with slabs of meat. Whatever the siblings didn't eat, they donated to the servants and the rest to the local Toad orphanage.

"Oh, wow, this looks delicious!" Lemon practically squealed. "I wanna try them! Please, please, I wanna try them!"

"Oh, sounds like someone's getting hungry," Peach observed as she held up her breasts from the bottom, a teasing glint shining in her eye and a coy smirk at the corner of her mouth. "Are you hungry, little brother? Are you sure you're really hungry?"

"Yes, yes, I'm hungry!" Lemon shouted, bobbing in place in his guardian's cleavage. "Come on, big sis, let's sit down already! Please!? I'm hungry!"

"Now now, Lemon, you're gonna get your food," Peach said teasingly, making Lemon's eagerness fade away and replaced with uncertainty. The boy could only watch as Peach adjusted her breasts with one arm and reach for him with her other white-gloved hand.

What happens next?

1.) Peach takes Lemon out so he could join her and her friends for breakfast.
2.) Peach stuffs Lemon further into her cleavage, and the prince is held tightly as Peach goes on with her get together with her friends.
3.) Peach takes Lemon out, plants him on her plate, and buries him in food so she could tease him by eating the food around him (and possibly him, too).
4.) Peach takes Lemon out and places him on the floor where he has to dodge the giant feet of his giant sister and her friends.
5.) Peach takes Lemon out and puts him in one of the seats at the table so he could be squashed under his sister's or friends' behinds.
15311412.title: Big Sister Peach

15312.content:
The Legend of Zelda series is one of Nintendo’s staple series that’s broadened it’s own horizons since the original game was released in the early 1980’s.

The original Legend of Zelda features a top-down view of the game’s iconic hero, Link, as he explores the overworld of Hyrule and dungeons to rescue the fair Princess Zelda from the clutches of Ganon by restoring the Triforce of Wisdom. The game became such a huge success that Nintendo launched the titular game franchise that video game fans know and love, with iconic releases such as A Link to the Past, Ocarina of Time, and Breath of the Wild not only driving the franchise to success, but also becoming significant milestones in the development of video games as a whole.

Decades after the launch of the first Legend of Zelda game, Nintendo released an official timeline in their book, Hyrule Historia, explaining the chronological order of the game series, from Hyrule’s foundation in Skyward Sword to the timelines diverging into three separate timelines during the events of Ocarina of Time.

The first timeline, The Fallen Hero Timeline, contains the events of Zelda games featuring the series’s overhead view functions, such as A Link to the Past, Link’s Awakening, and A Link Between Worlds. The second timeline, the Child Timeline, contains the events of Majora’s Mask, the sequel to Ocarina of Time, and Twilight Princess. The third timeline, the Adult Timeline containing the events of Zelda games featuring Toon Link, including The Wind Waker, it’s sequel The Phantom Hourglass, and Spirit Tracks.

The Great Calamity timeline remains unclear where in the official timeline it belongs, seeing as it contains multiple references to all three timelines above, so for the sake of argument, that timeline will be separated into its own category, containing events from Breath of the Wild, it’s ambiguously canon prequel, Hyrule Warriors: Age of Calamity, and the sequel.

The only question is, which timeline will you choose to follow?

Hylia & the Hero of Time (i.e. Skyward Sword, Minish Cap, Four Swords, Ocarina of Time)

Fallen Hero Timeline (i.e. A Link to the Past, Link’s Awakening, A Link Between Worlds, Oracle series)

Child Timeline (i.e. Majora’s Mask, Twilight Princess, Four Swords Adventure)

Adult Timeline (i.e. Wind Waker, Phantom Hourglass, Spirit Tracks)

-or-

Great Calamity Timeline (i.e. Hyrule Warriors: Age of Calamity, Breath of the Wild, the sequel)
15312.title: The Legend of Zelda series

153121.content:
This timeline contains the events of The Legend of Zelda: Skyward Sword, The Minish Cap, and Ocarina of Time in chronological order.

Prior to the events of Skyward Sword, the three Golden Goddesses - Din, Goddess of Power; Nayru, Goddess of Wisdom; and Farore, Goddess of Courage - descended upon the chaos of the universe and created the realm of what would be known later as Hyrule. Din created the material realm, Nayru gave the realm order and law, and Farore created life to follow the order. When the world was created and their labors done, the three Golden Goddess left behind a piece of their essence in the form of three golden triangles called the Triforce and left it in the careful hands of the Goddess Hylia before departing into the heavens.

After the creation of the realm, the Demon King Demise sought to wield the power of the Triforce, so he led a horde of demons onto the realm to wrest it from Hylia's hands. To prevent this, Hylia gathered the remaining humans of the land and sent an outcropping of the land into the sky where the Triforce was hidden inside the floating outcrop above the cloudy barrier. Hylia and the five tribes of the land battled Demise and sealed him away where the outcrop used to be, but the Goddess suffered many injuries. She tasked the spirit within the Goddess Sword, Fi, to assist her chosen champion before she was reborn in the form of a mortal girl, the first Zelda in the floating outcropping called Skyloft.

In Skyward Sword, Zelda was forced from the sky by a tornado conjured up by Demise's servant, Ghirahim, prompting Zelda's childhood friend, Link to find her. After Link meets Fi, the spirit residing within the Goddess Sword, he is tasked to obtain the gifts of the three Sacred Flames to bless the Goddess Sword into the Master Sword. After Zelda reveals herself to be Hylia's mortal form and was put into a deep slumber, Link is tasked to gather parts of the "Song of the Hero" from the Goddess's appointed dragons to unlock the entrance to the Sky Keep where the Triforce laid hidden. The Hero eventually reaches the Triforce and sends Skyloft plummeting into the ground, destroying Demise's sealed form, The Imprisoned.

Just as Zelda reawakens, she is kidnapped by Ghirahim and sent to the past where the Demon Lord successfully drains Hylia's essence into The Imprisoned, absorbing Zelda's essence and reawakening Demise. After a victorious battle against the Demon King, Demise curses Link and Zelda's later incarnations into a never-ending cycle against Demise's mortal forms before he was destroyed. Link and Zelda return to the present, and the land of Hyrule was established.

Prior to the events of The Minish Cap, the land of Hyrule was infested by evil spirits who were turning the land of Hyrule into darkness. Just as the world seemd to be cast in shadow, the tiny humanoid race, the Picoris/Minish descended from the skies and bestowed a courageous hero the Light Force and the Picori Blade. The Hero of Men used his wisdom and courage, along with his gifts to defeat the demons and restore peace in the world.

In The Minish Cap, Link's childhood friend, Princess Zelda is sealed in stone by the Sorcerer of Winds, Vaati during a tournament in the midst of the celebration of the Picori's first appearance in Hyrule. Vaati was formerly a Minish, an apprentice under the wise Minish sage, Ezlo, who created a magical wishing cap that granted the wearer their wishes. Vaati stole the magical cap, became a powerful sorcerer, turned Ezlo into a talking bird-like cap, and went to steal the Light Force form himself.

Tasked by the King of Hyrule to seek out the Picori's help, Link travels to Minish Woods where he meets Ezlo in his cap form, attacked by a group of Octoroks. After Link saves Ezlo, the former Minish sage helps Link travel to the Minish Village by shrinking down to the size of the Picori, and is given the task to reforce the Picor Blade by collecting the Four Elements, the embodiments of earth, air, fire, and water. After obtaining the Four Elements and fusing them with the Picori Blade inside the Elemental Sanctuary hidden within Hyrule Castle, the sacred Four Sword was reforged, and Link uses its duplication powers and his shrinking abilities to defeat Vaati's ghastly forms and seal him away in the Four Sword. Princess Zelda is released from her stone imprisonment and Hyrule is restored to peace.

In Ocarina of Time, the evil king of the Gerudos, Ganondorf, sought the Triforce by sending monsters to sicken Kokiri Forest, Death Mountain, and Zora's Domain where each of the locations kept hidden a Spiritual Stone to unlock the Master Sword sealed within the Temple of Time, the key to the gateway to the Sacred Realm where the Triforce was kept safe. Young Link, a young Hylian raised by the Kokiri, a race of forest children appointed with a fairy guardian, was given his fairy partner, Navi, to help save the land of Hyrule from Ganondorf.

When Link claimed the three Spiritual Stones by vanquishing Ganondorf's monsters, the King of Evil made his move by raiding Hyrule Castle. Link is given the Royal Family's most sacred treasure, the Ocarina of Time, by Princess Zelda as she rode to safety with her retainer, Impa. After Link gained access to the Master Sword inside the Temple of Time, Ganondorf followed Link into the Sacred Realm, claimed the Triforce, and plunged Hyrule into seven years of chaos. Meanwhile, Link grew to become seven years older, armed with the Master Sword, and tasked by Rauru, the Sage of Light to gather the six Sages of each race in Hyrule. Aided by the mysterious Sheik, Link gathers the Sages and defeats Ganondorf's monsters in each hidden Temple.

After the last Sage was rescued, Sheik reveals himself to be Princess Zelda in disguise right before she was kidnapped by Ganondorf and imprisoned within his castle where Hyrule Castle once stood. After a lengthy battle against the King of Evil, Link defeats Ganondorf, who is then sealed in the Dark Realm by the Sages. Guilty about being a part into Link's forced maturity as a child, Princess Zelda uses the Ocarina of Time to send Link back seven years to stop Ganondorf, while Navi flies away with her task completed.

In the sequel, Majora's Mask, Link is ambushed by two Fairies, Tatl and Tael, working with their partner, Skull Kid. While Skull Kid played with the Ocarina of Time gifted to Link by Princess Zelda, the child Hero of Time pursues Skull Kid into the parallel world of Termina where he is turned into a Deku Scrub by the effects of the eerie Majora's Mask stolen from the Happy Mask Salesman.

As part of an agreement, the Happy Mask Salesman tasks Link to retrieve his Ocarina of Time and Majora's Mask from the Skull Kid within three days' time in exchange that the Salesman would teach him a song to restore him back to his former form. Link, along with Tatl who was accidentally left behind by Skull Kid, aids Link in retrieving the Ocarina of Time, but discovers that Skull Kid was using the power of the mask to send the Moon to collide with Termina in three days' time. By repeatedly using the Ocarina of Time and traveling back to the first day, Link and Tatl travel to the four different areas in Termina's cardinal directions where they must defeat the Skull Kids' masked monsters and awaken the Four Giants to prevent the Moon from destroying the world.

After awakening the Four Giants, Link prevents the Moon from falling onto Termina while also breaking Majora's Mask's influence over the Skull Kid. Link then travels inside the Moon to defeat the three different forms of Majora and restore peace to Termina. Link and Skull Kid become friends, the Happy Mask Salesman leaves with the depowered Majora's Mask back in his hands, and Link ventures off to search for Navi, never heard from again.

(A/N: Although Majora's Mask takes place in the Child Timeline, it would make sense to merge both Ocarina of Time and Majora's Mask into a single route.)

The only question is, which game(s) will you choose?

Skyward Sword

The Minish Cap

-or-

Ocarina of Time/Majora's Mask
153121.title: Hylia/Force/Hero of Time

1531213.content:
The boy is a character from The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time and its sequel, Majora's Mask.

The only question is, which of these scenarios will you apply to the young male characters in both games?

Size-Alteration: There are many ways a character from The Legend of Zelda series can shrink and grow. In one scenario, a boy character(s) finds a mushroom spore in a forested area which permanently shrinks anyone who comes into contact with the spore, but can be administered with an antidote. In another scenario, the characters have their sizes altered by magic, from boys within the age limit being shrunken by Majora's Mask to female characters growing to giant size by the Giant's Mask. In another scenario, the characters have their sizes affected by a size-alteration potion which spells disaster for whoever drinks it, even more so when the potion spills into the river, Hyrule's main freshwater supply.

Born Tiny: The young male character(s) are a fraction of the hundreds of children born tiny due to the genetic deficiency of the XY chromosome, so with a world full of predominantly female characters, they are doted on by the giant girls in their lives, or they are seduced by them. The lands of Hyrule and Termina is dangerous enough at normal size, but that danger at their size is multiplied a hundred fold.

Normal-Size Among Giantesses: The male character(s) are born normal-sized, but the female characters in the series are more massive than him. In one scenario, the boy is close friends with/raised by the Great Fairies, who are already gigantic in comparison to a normal-sized Hylian. In another scenario, after the events of Ocarina of Time and/or Majora's Mask, the women seem to be larger than normal size by an unknown form of magic, with the young girls being the size of the Goron chief, Darunia and the adults as large as a two-story house in Castle Town Square. In another scenario, the Gerudo become taller than their average normal adult size seen in both games, and they're looking to adopt/play with the male characters who enter their territory.

-or-

Space-Time Rift: The young male character(s) accidentally open or discover a rift in space of time that takes them to anywhere in Hyrule, or into a different era in the past for the future. The only problem is that the rift also has some nasty side-effects which makes the young male character(s) appear as small as a Minish on the other side of the rift and at the mercy of the gigantic female characters!
1531213.title: Ocarina of Time/Majora's Mask

15312131.content:
The characters from The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time and its sequel, Majora's Mask had their sizes altered.

The only question is, which of these scenarios will you apply to the young male characters in both games?

Shrinking Spores: There is a rare but dangerous mushroom growing in grasslands, forests, and woodlands called the Vaati's Cap. When touched, it released little spores which shrinks the character to the size of a Minish and turn their skin color to purple and their eyes red. There is an antidote that can be administered, but the process takes too much time and the ingredients are rare to find, so the character who inhaled the spores are permanently tiny.

Curse of the Masks: In Termina, the Masks contain special magical abilities that even linger in the outskirts of that parallel dimension. However, the Masks aren't to be used very lightly because doing so will create a magical drawback. In one scenario, Skull Kid uses Majora's Mask to shrink down a character (himself included) and is teleported somewhere in Termina or even Hyrule. In another scenario, the Giant's Mask is worn by a female character, and she interacts with the boy they're closely associated with. In another scenario, Link uses the Song of Healing to heal a wounded Minish and transforms his spirit into the Minish Mask, which he uses to shrink and explore his gigantic world.

Goddess-Sized Gerudo: In Hyrule, Koume and Kotake, the old twin witches who raised Ganondorf with the ability to merge into giant witch, Twinrova, exacts their revenge on Young Link and/or the youth of Hyrule by brainwashing the Gerudo, then using their magic to alter someone's size. They either shrink their victims and they become the Gerudos' plaything, or they expand the Gerudos and send them rampaging into Hyrule as an army of hypnotized giantesses. Either way, Twinrova will be assured both victory and the satisfaction of revenge.

-or-

Puny-Sized Potions or Enormous Elixirs: There is a potion brewed in either Hyrule or Termina which affects the size of the person who drinks it. In one scenario, a boy accidentally drinks the shrinking potion and he shrinks to tiny size in an inconvenient area. In another scenario, a girl accidentally drinks the growth potion and she grows into a towering giantess and interacts with the boy she's closely associated with. In another scenario, the potions are accidentally spilled into the river, and either the boys shrink or the girls grow when they drink it.
15312131.title: Size-Alteration

153121312.content:
The characters from The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time and its sequel, Majora's Mask had their sizes altered by the effects of the Masks.

The only question is, which which of these scenarios will you apply to the characters in both games?

Majora's Miniaturization Magic: When the Skull Kid put on the accursed Majora's Mask, he gained the power to utilize dark magical powers to cause dangerous mischief around Termina. At one point, the Skull Kid uses Majora's Mask to shrink a boy(s) that he targeted and teleported them to an area in Termina or beyond where the female characters are prominently seen. In one scenario, Majora's Mask strips itself from Skull Kid when the imp's usefulness came to an end and shrinks him down to size.

The Giant Mask's Girl Gigantification: The Giant's Mask is a mask that is only worn in the Stone Tower Temple in Termina, but somehow, when the Giant's Mask is worn by a female character in either Hyrule or Termina, it causes them to grow into a colossal giantess. Somewhere down the line, the Giant's Mask's magic allows its wearer to share some of its magical abilities into another female character. They then loom over the boy they're closely associated with, like Link, Mido or Kafei.

-or-

The Minish Mask: During his adventures in Termina, Young Link comes across a Picori/Minish mortally injured by one of the Skull Kid's cruel pranks when he compelled the Snappers to mutiliate the defenseless little creature. Using the Song of Healing, Link heals the Minish's spirit and transforms into the Minish Mask where he transforms into a tiny Minish that only children can see, but remain invisible to the adults.
153121312.title: Curse of the Masks

choices: The Bombers Secret Society of Justice
1531213121.content:
The character is a boy from The Legend of Zelda: Majora's Mask whose size has been altered by Majora's Mask.

The only question is, which of these characters is going to be shrunk by Majora's Mask?

Young Link: During his pursuit of the Skull Kid in the Lost Woods, Link stumbles into a certain tree trunk sending him into the underground catacombs connecting the Lost Woods to the parallel world of Termina. When he fell onto the Deku Flower, Link was then cursed by the Skull Kid wearing Majora's Mask, who shrinks him to showcase his power over him. He is then teleported by Majora's Mask to a place in Hyrule where one of his female friends is present.

Kafei: After a night of drinking and celebrating his engagement to Anju, an inebriated Kafei brushes the Skull Kid away, causing him to use Majora's Mask to shrink him down and teleports him to another area in Termina. He has three days to return to the Milk Bar where he met the Skull Kid or his change will be permanent.

Skull Kid: The Skull Kid has successfully used the power of Majora's Mask to wreak havoc across Termina. He engaged in criminal mischief, sealed away the Four Giants inside their own Temples, and summoned the Moon to crash into Termina in three days. As the third day arrived, when the Skull Kid's usefulness was finished, Majora's Mask suddenly strips itself away and shrinks him with his powers. He is left at the mercy of the giant women he wronged in Termina.

-or-

The Bombers Secret Society of Justice: Led by their Leader, Jim, the Bombers Secret Society of Justice is a small group of six boys who strive to do good in their home town of Clock Town. One day, Jim lets the Skull Kid join in on their fun, but they regret it when the Skull Kid's dark magic mask shrinks them down less than the size of an ant. The Bombers must work together to survive the hostile, giant world where even the Deku Princess is as large as one of the Four Giants themselves!
1531213121.title: Majora's Miniaturization Magic

1531213122.content:
The character is a girl from The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time and/or its sequel, Majora's Mask whose size has been altered by the Giant's Mask.

Since there are a lot of female characters in both games, it would make sense that this story route would feature two scenarios based around the female characters growing into a giant by the Giant's Mask, each one taking place in either Hyrule or Termina.

The only question is, which of these scenarios will you apply to the female characters of both games?

The Humongous Girls of Hyrule: After returning from his travels in Termina, Link and Princess Zelda catch up on their time apart from each other. When Link shows Zelda the Masks he collected in his journeys, Zelda curiously puts on the Giant's Mask and instantly becomes a masked giantess. At some points, Zelda transfers some of her powers to her friends and fellow Sages and they grow into giants themselves.

-or-

The Titanesses of Termina: During his travels in Termina, Link settles down for the night at Romani's Ranch where the eponymous red-haired girl curiously shuffles through his knapsack and pulls out the Giant's Mask. Romani quickly reaches giant size and has a little fun with her little "grasshopper", as well as the citizens of Clock Town. At some points, Romani transfers some of her powers to her older sister, Cremia, and her friends.
1531213122.title: The Giant Mask's Girl Gigantification

choices: The Bombers Secret Society of Justice
15312132.content:
The boy is a character from The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time and its sequel, Majora's Mask who was born small.

The only question is, which one of these boys will you choose?

Young Link: Link was born to a Hylian woman who perished at the roots of the Great Deku Tree and entrusted her son's safety to him and the Kokiri children. Growing up, Link would have many adventures in the Kokiri Forest often under the watchful protection of his guardian and Forest Sage, Saria, who like the other other Kokiri girls, watched over their tiny male charges. Link is close friends with Princess Zelda, Princess Ruto, and Malon, and is engaged in combat training and discipline under Impa, Nabooru, and the Gerudo. At some point, Link will accidentally find a rift in space and time that sends him into a different era of Hyrule, even in a parallel dimension like Termina.

Kafei: Kafei is the young son of Madame Aroma, the wife of the miniscule mayor of Clock Town in Termina. Despite being young and tiny, Kafei is currently engaged to the Stock Pot Innkeeper, Anju, and by their mothers' blessings, the two are set to be married during the Carnival of Time. Kafei also often interacts with Anju's friends, Cremia and Romani, the Indigo-Go's singer Lulu, and the Rosa Sisters. Because of his handsomeness, Kafei is the target of every girl's desires and will often try to snatch him right from under Anju's nose.

Skull Kids: The Skull Kids are male Hylian children who were transformed into creaky, straw-like imps by the mysterious magic of the Lost Woods. The Skull Kids are known for their love of madcap pranks, mischief, and music. Every so often, the tiny Skull Kids play with the Kokiri girls who venture into the Lost Woods and often play music. At other times, when they feel particularly mischievous, the Skull Kids call upon a bird friend of theirs to fly them to Hyrule where they hope to pull their mischeivous pranks on the unsuspecting giant women of Hyrule, including the Crown Princess Zelda herself!

The Kokiri Boys: While Link ventures into the Lost Woods or accompany Saria around Hyrule to spend time with his female friends, the Kokiri Boys are put under constant surveillance from the other Kokiri girls. Among them is Mido, Link's childhood rival and bully, and the intelligent Know-It-All Brothers, who wonder what it's like outside Kokiri Forest despite the dire threat of their death upon setting foot outside the forest's borders. In a secret group meeting, Mido and the Know-It-All Brothers plan to sneak out the next time Saria ventures outside the forest, but they'll soon discover how dangerous the outside world of Hyrule can be.

-or-

The Bombers Secret Society of Justice: Led by their Leader, Jim, the Bombers Secret Society of Justice is a small group of six boys who strive to do good in their home town of Clock Town. One day, Jim has an idea to spread the idea of justice around the land of Termina, despite how dangerous it is outside of Clock Town's guarded gates, which leads the boys into no small shortage of unintended mischief and trouble in every province of Termina (except for the Snowhead Mountains since no female characters exist up there).
15312132.title: Born Tiny

15312133.content:
The boy is a character from The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time and its sequel, Majora's Mask that's born normal-sized but is among larger female characters.

The only question is, which of these scenarios will you apply to the young male characters in both games?

Related to the Great Fairies: The young male character is related to the Great Fairies, the giant female humanoid form of the Fairies who are much larger in comparison to a normal-sized person. The boy is either close friends with one or all of the Great Fairies in the games, or he is an orphan who was raised by the Great Fairies as their surrogate son. The Great Fairies are jovial and jolly, which either fits well with the boy's character or completely contrasts it.

Girls Grown Wild: In the events of Ocarina of Time and/or Majora's Mask, the female characters seem to be larger than the young male characters, grown by an unknown form of magic. They have either grown into Amazonian size, or grown into the size of the Four Giants from Termina, leaving the young male characters feeling small and puny before their size and might. (A/N: The female characters' heights are variable, so long as the younger characters seen in either games has the minimum height of six feet or more).

-or-

Amazons of the Desert: Taking a page out of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, the Gerudo seen in Ocarina of Time and Majora's Mask are grown to Amazonian size, with the younger Gerudo the size of a normal-sized adult, but the adult Gerudo growing up to fifteen feet tall. With their size, they can adopt and/or dominate the male characters from both games, including the younger male characters.
15312133.title: Normal-Sized Among Giantesses

153123.content:
The Child Timeline contains the events of Twilight Princess, and Four Swords Adventure.

Prior to the events of Twilight Princess, in ancient times, a group of Hylians called the Dark Interlopers attempted to take control of Hyrule and use the Triforce for their own purposes using their dark powers. In response to this, the three Golden Goddesses - Din, Goddess of Power; Nayru, Goddess of Wisdom; and Farore, Goddess of Courage - called upon four light spirits from each province of Hyrule and sealed their power away in the Fused Shadow. Then the Dark Interlopers were banished into the Twilight Realm through the Mirror of Twilight where they adapted to the Twilight and became the race known as the Twili.

Many centuries later, after the events of Ocarina of Time, Ganondorf's intentions to dominate Hyrule and claim the Triforce were exposed, so he was captured, tried, and executed by the Six Sages. When the Six Sages used their sword to mortally wound Ganondorf, the Triforce of Power was activated, and Ganondorf broke free from his chains and immediately killed the Sage of Water. The Sages, fearful of this power, banished Ganondorf into the Twilight Realm where his spirit aided the power-hungry Zant into giving him the power to turn the Twili into mindless beasts, usurp the throne from the Twilight Princess Midna, and send Hyrule and the World of Light into darkness.

In Twilight Princess, two centuries after Ocarina of Time, Link's home province of Ordona was invaded by monsters and the Twilight Beasts. He ventured into the twilight where he is forcibly transformed into a wolf, catching the attention of Midna in her cursed imp form, wearing a chunk of her Fused Shadow. In this form, Wolf Link meets Princess Zelda who tasks him and Midna to retrieve the Fused Shadows and restore light to Hyrule with the aid of the light spirits. After collecting the Fused Shadow, Zant forces Midna into the World of Light, mortally wounding her until she is healed by Zelda at the cost of her own spirit.

Link and Midna venture to the Sacred Grove where Link pulls the Master Sword from its resting place in the ruins of the Temple of Time. He then journeys around Hyrule to retrieve the Mirror of Twilight to reopen the gateway into the Twilight Realm where they vanquish Zant, who reveals Ganondorf has returned to Hyrule. With the power of the Fused Shadow, Link and Midna journey into Hyrule Castle and defeat Ganondorf's spirit, who possessed Zelda's body and transformed into a beast. In a final battle against the King of Evil, Link plunges the Master Sword into Ganondorf's heart and kills him, breaking the curse over Midna, revealing her true, beautiful form. Midna departs from the World of Light and the Mirror of Twilight shatters.

In Four Swords Adventure, Princess Zelda calls upon her six Maidens and attempts to enforce the seal on the sword, but the shadowy form of Link kidnaps Zelda and the Maidens, and provokes Link to pull the Four Sword from its pedestal. In doing so, Link not only is split into four separate Links, but he breaks the Sorcerer of Winds, Vaati from his seal, freeing him.

The four Links travel across Hyrule and work together to stop the chaos caused by Shadow Link and Vaati, where they also discover that Vaati has been resurrected and used by the King of Darkness, Ganon. Ganon was once a man named Ganondorf who stole the legendary Trident which gave him the power of darkness, as well as the ability to spawn Shadow Links as resentment from being defeated by Link in Twilight Princess. After rescuing the six Maidens, the four Links confront Vaati in the Palace of Winds where Ganon reveals himself as the true mastermind behind the chaos.

With the combined efforts of the four Links, Princess Zelda, and the six Maidens, Ganon is sealed inside the Four Sword and laid to rest again. The four Links merge back into the singular Link, who is hailed by Hyrule as a hero.

The only question is, which of these games will you follow?
153123.title: Child Timeline

153125.content:
This route accounts for the different Legend of Zelda games that are either unclear where in the official timeline the games belong to, games featuring ambiguously canon content or spin-offs, or games that have yet to be released.

The Great Calamity timeline remains unclear where in the official Legend of Zelda timeline it belongs, seeing as it contains multiple references to the different timelines in the previous chapter, so for the sake of argument, this timeline will be separated into its own category, containing events from Breath of the Wild, it’s ambiguously canon prequel, Hyrule Warriors: Age of Calamity, and the upcoming sequel.

While we're on the subject of ambiguously canon (or non-canon games), there are a few Legend of Zelda spin-off games to account for that don't belong in the official timeline, such as Hyrule Warriors, Cadence of Hyrule, and possibly even more. (A/N: Super Smash Bros. will not be included in this route, as it has its own route.)

The only question is, which route will you follow?

The Great Calamity Timeline (i.e. Breath of the Wild, Hyrule Warriors: Age of Calamity, or the upcoming sequel)

-or-

Spin-Offs (i.e. Hyrule Warriors, Cadence of Hyrule, etc.)
153125.title: Other

1531251.content:
This timeline contains the events of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, its upcoming sequel, and the ambiguously canon Hyrule Warriors: Age of Calamity.

Prior to the events of Breath of the Wild, according to legend, Calamity Ganon is the primal source of evil that's plagued Hyrule for over ten thousand years. With the aid of the Sheikah's ancient weaponry, the Guardians, and the four pilotable Divine Beasts designed to combat Calamity Ganon, the princess who carries the blood of the goddess and the hero who possesses the spirit of the hero sealed the Calamity away.

One hundred years prior to the events of Breath of the Wild, Princess Zelda struggled to fulfill her duties to awaken her powers to seal away the foreseen return of the Calamity, and her animosity towards her chosen knight, Link, whose possession of the Master Sword reminded her of her failures. The Sheikah technology had been unearthed, as well as the Guardians and the Divine Beasts. Each of the Divine Beasts were piloted by a Champion of the other four races governing Hyrule: the Rito, the Gorons, the Zoras, and the Gerudo. With the Champions assembled, victory seemed to be at hand.

Unfortunately, Zelda's inability to awaken her power accelerated Ganon's return to Hyrule. Using his malice, the Calamity infected the Guardians and sent Blights to infect each of the Divine Beasts and kill their chosen pilots. As the infected Guardians were about to destroy Link and Zelda, the princess's power awakened as the mortally injured hero laid dying. Compelled by the voice of the Master Sword, Zelda ordered the Sheikah to place Link into the Shrine of Resurrection and put the sword into a slumber before the roots of the Great Deku Tree. With her power, Zelda sealed herself and Ganon within Hyrule Castle and waited until Link's return in the next one hundred years.

In Breath of the Wild, Link wakes up to a beautiful voice half-naked, having no memory of his placement as per the effects of the Shrine of Resurrection. The story of Hyrule was imparted to himt by the ghost of King Rhoam Bosphoramus Hyrule, who urged Link to seek out Impa, the Sheikah elder, and save his daughter, Zelda. At Impa's urge, Link sought after fragments of his memories, traveled the land of Hyrule to destroy the Blights infecting the Divine Beasts, and freed them along with the ghosts of their pilots. With his strength fully returned, Link ventured into the Korok Woods and pulled the Master Sword from its pedestal. He then infiltrated the malice-infected Hyrule Castle and battled Calamity Ganon, weakened by the Divine Beasts' combined assault. During one final battle with the Dark Beast Ganon, Zelda bestows Link the Bow of Light and defeats the beast, freeing Zelda from its hold and allowing her to seal him away. Hyrule is saved, and peace is restored.

(A/N: The summary of the upcoming sequel will be added here later! Also, no one is permitted to add to the sequel route until its official release and gameplay.)

The only question is, which of these scenarios will you choose?

Size-Alteration: There are many ways a character from The Legend of Zelda series can shrink and grow. In one scenario, a boy character(s) finds a mushroom spore in a forested area which permanently shrinks anyone who comes into contact with the spore, but can be administered with an antidote. In another scenario, the characters have their sizes altered by Calamity Ganon's malice, from boys within the age limit being shrunken to female characters growing to giant size.

Born Tiny: The young male character(s) are a fraction of the hundreds of children born tiny due to the genetic deficiency of the XY chromosome, so with a world full of predominantly female characters, they are doted on by the giant girls in their lives, or they are seduced by them. In another scenario, a boy is from a race of tiny people based on Breath of the Wild's concept art. The lands of Hyrule and Termina is dangerous enough at normal size, but that danger at their size is multiplied a hundred fold.

Normal-Size Among Giantesses: The male character(s) are born normal-sized, but the female characters in the series are more massive than him. In one scenario, the boy is close friends with/raised by the Great Fairies, who are already gigantic in comparison to a normal-sized Hylian. In another scenario, the women seem to be larger than normal size by an unknown form of magic, with the young girls being the size of the Goron chief, Daruk, and the adults as large as a two-story house in Castle Town Square. In another scenario, the Gerudo become taller than their average normal adult size seen in both games, and they're looking to adopt/play with the male characters who enter their territory.

-or-

Space-Time Rift: The young male character(s) accidentally open or discover a rift in space of time that takes them to anywhere in Hyrule, or into a different era in the past for the future. The only problem is that the rift also has some nasty side-effects which makes the young male character(s) appear as small as a Minish on the other side of the rift and at the mercy of the gigantic female characters!
1531251.title: Great Calamity Timeline

15314.content:
Super Smash Bros. is the ultimate crossover fighting game series, combining different characters from different Nintendo franchises, as well as third-party universe from non-Nintendo game companies such as Sonic the Hedgehog, Metal Gear Solid, Street Fighter, Bayonetta, and much, much more

The original Super Smash Bros. was released for the Nintendo 64, featuring only eight characters, including the Mario Bros., Donkey Kong, Samus, Pikachu, Jigglypuff Kirby, Fox, Yoshi, Ness, and Captain Falcon. In Super Smash Bros. Melee and since then, the franchise grew to include more characters from their franchises, including antagonistic characters.

Super Smash Bros. Brawl introduced their first third-party universes with the inclusion of Sonic the Hedgehog and Snake from their respective game series, and this was expanded upon in the fourth game and Ultimate with the inclusion of Bandai Namco, CAPCOM, Konami, Microsoft, and other major video game development companies. The rest of the scenarios are reserved for the reader's choice.

In this story route, we'll be exploring the young male characters of the franchise as they're interacting with the gigantic female characters in the franchise, either with the boys being shrunken or the girls being giant-sized. (A/N: You can also include previous designs of characters from the previous Super Smash Bros. games as separate characters, such as Zelda. Female Assist Trophies such as Lyn and Barbara the Bat are also included in this route.) The rest of the scenarios are reserved for the reader's choice.

The only question is, which route will you choose?

Shrunken: In this route's first two scenarios, the young male characters in the franchise have been shrunken after obtaining the Poison Mushroom OR the female characters have found a way to bypass the Custom Smash rules so they would remain normal-sized while the boys remain tiny-sized and are easily subjected to their whims.

Giant: In this route's first two scenarios, the female characters appearing in the franchise have grown into giant size after obtaining the Super Mushroom OR they have found a way to bypass the Custom Smash rules so they would remain giant-sized while the boys are still normal-sized but are easily subjected to their whims.
15314.title: Super Smash Bros. series

154.content:
Since the days when stories written in papers and ink quills, there have been many stories and fairy tales about heroic young male characters born the size of a thumb, mythical realms inhabited by giants and/or tiny people, and sometimes even a bit of both.

Fairy tales such as Jack and the Beanstalk features the young main character Jack climbing up the beanstalk into a cloudy land inhabited by giants. A common trope among Tom Thumb-styled fairy tales, such as the eponymous story and the Japanese legend of Issun-boshi, features a consistent story of a poor peasant couple wishing for a child, and is granted with a boy born the size of a thumb. It also features the tiny boys getting eaten by gigantic beasts and giants.

Literature novels such as Gulliver's Travels features two separate islands each inhabited by the diminutive Lilliputians and the giant Brobdingnagians. May Norton's The Borrowers series, and John Peterson's The Littles series both feature miniature people living in the walls of an inhabited home who borrow and/or steal from the occupants.

For the sake of argument and variety within the Literature Books route, which of these stories will you choose?

Jack and the Beanstalk

Tom Thumb-styled stories

Gulliver's Travels

-or-

The Borrowers/The Littles
154.title: Literature Books

1541.content:
Once upon a time, outside of a small but prosperous village, there lived an eleven year-old boy named Jack who lived in poverty with his mother. The mother's heart became bitter and cold from the death of Jack's father and the misfortune which followed. While the village prospered, Jack's farm was dried up with an unquenchable drought. The chickens could not lay any more eggs, so they were all slaughtered. Even the farm's cow, Old Bessie, could not produce anymore milk.

One day, Jack and his mother discovered that they had only a few shillings and they could not afford to buy food, so the mother forced the cow's reins into his hand and ordered, "Jack, use what little brains you have and go to the market and sell Old Bessie for profit, and don't give me anything less than what she is valued right now."

Upon his stern mother's orders, Jack took Old Bessie to market and showcased her to any of the denizens in the village, but none of them would take her. Just then, a strange old man beckoned him and the cow over to him and said, "My dear boy, I do not have a shilling on me, but I will make you a better deal. If you give me your cow, then I will give you this box of magic beans. Plant them, and greater fortune will come your way."

Jack was hesitant, but then again, what good will a handful of shillings do for him and his mother when it will only grant them temporary relief from hunger? So Jack exchanged Old Bessie for the beans and merrily skipped his way home. When he told his mother about the exchange with the old man, the mother angrily smacked the beans out the window, struck him, and angrily chastised him, “You foolish boy! You stupid foolish boy! We would never fill our bellies on one bean, let alone three! You have been a shameful disgrace since you were growing in my belly! That is why I wish it was you rather than your father who should have died!"

Jack was so heartbroken that he had sequestered himself in his room for the rest of the day, his eye blackened from the strike. During that night, the magical beans began to sprout and quickly grew into a giant beanstalk tall enough to stretch into the sky, into the clouds and the heavens above.

The next morning, Jack and his mother were amazed by the sight of the giant beanstalk sprouting from their very own backyard. The beans alone were the size of a horse wagon, enough to fill their bellies and sell for a pretty profit. At her request, Jack's mother urged him, "Well, what are you waiting for, you stupid boy!? Climb up that beanstalk and collect all of the beans you can find! Bring them down here so we may finally be rich again!"

Jack obeyed his mother and began to climb up the seemingly never-ending beanstalk, plucking every bean along the way and letting them fall to the ground. As he climbed higher, he found himself ascending into the clouds, the tiny ice particles chilling his skin. The more he climbed, the colder it seemed to get. He climbed higher and higher until finally, he surfaced above the clouds and into another realm consisting of clouds and the stars more beautiful than the nighttime. He was astounded to find himself in a garden as big as his village with vegetables bigger than the baron's house! Carrots, cabbages, radishes, cucumbers, tomatoes, and so much more, laid out all around him and open for him to pluck it all and to drop to the ground below.

Beyond the garden was a grandiose castle as big as a large mountain. The doors alone were bigger than the church up to its steeple. The curious Jack hiked through the garden and approached the foot of the door. He pounded it with all of his might. Not so long afterwards, the door opened and out stepped a giant woman the exact size of the steeple, to Jack's complete surprise.

“Hello?” the giantess called out to what she perceived as no one. “Who dares knock on my door and disappears so rudely!?"

The giantess hadn’t known that standing at her toes was an astounded little boy named Jack who was small enough to be eaten by her in one bite. The giantess then set her sights at the ground, and Jack’s blue eyes met her beautiful eyes as well. This particular giantess was...

1.)...a chubby giantess, a kind and loving protector and nourisher of tiny humans.

2.)...a muscular giantess, a barbaric torturer and devourer of tiny humans.

3.)...a young giantess two years Jack's senior, her perspective with the tiny humans ambiguous.
1541.title: Jack and the Beanstalk

choices: The Goose and Her Golden Eggs
Son of the Kind, Chubby Giantess
15411.content:
Name: Helga Fostrajotunn
Age: 415 years old (41.5 years in human age)
Eyes: Brown
Hair: Auburn
Height: 60' 10"
Weight: 500+ lbs.
Ethnicity: White/Caucasian
Backstory: Helga Fostrajotunn is a thick, chubby giantess who is blessed with a kind and nurturing side, especially towards creatures smaller than her hand and those who are younger than her. While most other giantesses prefer to indiscriminately devour and torture the tiny humans, Helga prefers to care and shelter the humans in her own home, which makes her an outcast among her own people. She works as her house's cleaner, cook, and gardener, but she does not mind the labor.

Main Story:
Jack was taken aback by the appearance of the giant woman standing at her doorway.

The giantess was pot-bellied, chubby around arms and her rotund face. She wore rags similar to the rags that his mother wore most of the time, including the white smock that was stained and dirtied by apparently long hours of labor. The rags dropped all the way to her leather-sandaled feet, caked and stained with dirt, especially in between her toenails and underneath her feet, seen as the giantess wiggled her toes. Her auburn hair, tied together in thick braids, was tucked underneath a rag wrapped around her head. Her eyes were as brown as the droughted dirt implanted around his house, and they gazed at him with surprise and childlike curiosity.

“By my word, can it be!?” The thick-bellied giantess bent down and quickly scooped up the tiny boy in her palm just before he could get away. Jack was caught in the giantess’s pillowy palm and struggled to move as he was lifted up into the air and up to her face. He got a better look at the giantess’s round, freckled face, her giant brown eyes brightened up in wonder.

“Why, it is! A little human boy has stumbled onto my home!” the giantess said marvelously, holding Jack to close proximity to her mouth.

The size of the giantess’s mouth frightened poor little Jack. The maw was like a cave deep under the sea, dark and wet where hardly any light shone inside its deeper darkness. Her tongue was like a giant pink serpent waiting for its next victim to devour, and the incisor teeth were the size of an executioner’s axe. Worse was the abyssal throat which led down to the boiling cauldron of the giantess’s stomach where her food dissolved underneath their burning juices.

“Please don’t hurt me, Miss Giant!” Jack begged, cowering in the flesh of her palm.

The giantess let out a hearty chuckle. “Worry not, my tiny friend, for I do not desire the taste of human flesh, not even to children such as yourself! I am Helga Fostrajotunn, a kindly giant from a faraway land of giants of myth! Who are you and what brings such a young one to my home?”

Jack was relieved to hear that the giantess was not partial to the taste of human flesh, and he opened himself up to his giant captor. "I am Jack, a poor and hungry boy from below the clouds. I was given magical beans from a strange man for my family’s cow, and over the night, the beans sprouted into a giant beanstalk that reached up into the clouds. My mother tasked me with climbing the stalk to pick the beans when I climbed through the clouds and beheld your garden and your castle.”

"I see," Helga listened with a nod. She reached her finger up, lifted Jack's shirt and gasped. "Why, you poor boy, you're nothing but skin and bones! Come inside. I will treat you to breakfast, but be warned, for most of my kin desires nothing but the taste of tiny young humans like yourself."

So Helga took Jack to her kitchen and treated him to breakfast as she promised. Placing him on the table, Helga served Jack crumbs of the previous night's supper which seemed like a feast for the village baron. A crumb of bread, a hunk of cheese, a slice of meat, and a thimble full of milk to wash it all down. As Jack was served a bit of honeycomb to add the sweet flavor of honey to his diet, the giantess watched him intently with curiosity, a motherly smile stretched across her rotund face.

"My goodness, you certainly were hungry, weren't you?" Helga inquired.

"Yes, Miss Helga," Jack said. "My farm was stricken by drought since my father's death, and we had to resort to eating our chickens who could not lay eggs. We had to sell my family's cow for profit, but I gave her up for the magic beans, and for that, my mother punished me."

"Punished you?" Helga parroted. She squinted carefully at Jack's youthful face and gasped at the sight of his black eye. "Oh, you poor dear! No mother should punish a child this way! I bet your mother also made you climb up the beanstalk in pursuit of riches rather than be concerned for the betterment of her own family!"

"It is no problem, Miss Helga," Jack insisted. "My mother worked to the bone to maintain our farm and she has ached her back. I am young and capable of handling arduous tasks myself."

"Now, that's enough. Even you must realize that your mother has replaced all of the love in her heart for her heart with bitterness and greed." Upon the giantess's words, the reality of his mother's hard words and physical punishments made Jack fall silent. His will to feast suddenly dissipated like the moisture of his farm which led to the accursed drought. "You are loyal to your mother and you hold much love for her, but has she ever returned that love to you? When has she ever declared her love for her own son, despite how poorly your family lives? Any mother who puts their own needs ahead of their own children can never be a real mother to me."

Jack felt the weight of Helga's words descend upon him like her sandaled foot. He pushed away his thimble and honeycomb and curled his knees to his chest. He sunk his head inside his legs and began to cry. "Oh, Helga, you are right! What am I to do!?" he sobbed to the giant woman. "My mother's heart has hardened since my father's death, and the farm has fallen into disaster! We have no money, and soon the baron's tax collectors will be on our doorstep! Worst of all, my mother despises me because of it all, preferring if I had died instead of my father! Oh, Helga, what am I to do!? What am I to do!?"

The giantess's heart broke at the sight of the young human lamenting at his own woes. The saddened giantess placed her palm behind Jack and gently stroke his back with her thumb. "Oh, Jack, I am sorry for how your life has granted you an unfair boon," Helga cooed, "but weep not, for I may have a solution to your problem which will undoubtedly aid you in years to come."

After a sniffle, Jack looked up to the reassuring giantess with hope in his eyes.

"Really? Are you certain?"

"Yes, my child, and it shall make you happy above all else."

What was Helga's solution?

1.) Helga helps Jack with his family's financial troubles with her prized golden goose.

2.) Helga adopts Jack as her surrogate human son.

3.) Before Helga could help Jack, another giantess approaches!
15411.title: The Kind, Chubby Giantess

choices: You Can't Reason with a Big, Bad Babe
A Feminine Twist on the Original Fable
15412.content:
Name: Marsha Laejotunn
Age: 387 years (38.7 in human years)
Eyes: Green
Hair: Black
Height: 70' 10"
Weight: 520+ lbs.
Ethnicity: White/Caucasian
Backstory: Marsha Laejotunn is a fierce, muscular member of the giants, as well as one of the strongest giant warriors in the realm. Marsha is well-known among her people and kin for her power and using her giant axe in battle, but she is also known for her excessive pride for herself and her race, meaning she's not below discriminating any other races, including humans. Everyone knows she views the tiny humans as bugs or delectable morsels, and when she's hungry for them, she likes the fresh taste of the young ones.

Main Story:
Jack was taken aback by the appearance of the giant woman standing at her doorway.

The giantess was massive and muscular, especially around the abdominal area where one of the pecs alone was as big as his house. Her raven black hair, as dark as a curtain of the night, hung down to her shoulders. She wore a barbaric outfit, wearing thick leather over her massive breasts concealed tightly behind a metallic breastplate, chained by a pauldron armor on each of her shoulders. At her waist below her exposed midriff, she wore a belt strapping a flowing leather skirt, a giant brown loincloth wrapped tightly under the area between her muscular legs. At her knees and trailing down to her feet, she wore a pair of tall leather boots, wrapped tightly with pelts. She also wore a pair of heavy leather wristbands wrapped around her wrists as well.

To complete this intimidating appearance, the giantess wore a stone-hardened scowl which softened as her verdant eyes met Jack's tiny form, never minding the fear in the boy's eyes while hers shone an uneasy gleefulness. "Well, what do we have here? A little human bug has decided to intrude upon my home," she said with a cold, dominant tone. "So nice of you to drop in for breakfast, little worm, especially since little human children are a big part of my breakfast."

Jack didn't even think twice about escaping when he saw the barbaric giantess hungrily lick her chops. The boy quickly turned tail and made for the garden, but he couldn't get more than ten feet away when the giantess suddenly stomped her leather-covered foot right behind him, the shock knocking him to the ground. Jack found himself laying on his belly, and as he tried to get up, a giant feminine hand suddenly clamped in on him, four powerful fingers and a thumb holding him tightly while it lifted the screaming boy up and to the giantess's face.

The colossal woman eyed the boy in her fist like a predator before leaping in for the kill. She chuckled darkly, watching the young human pitifully try to escape her grasp, only for her to squeeze her fist and compact his body. "Now, look at this mess you've gotten yourself into. I bet you must've come all the way to the castle just to get a good look at the mistress on the outside," the giantess taunted, running her tongue over her upper set of teeth. "Now that you've seen her, how would you like to get a better look at her on the inside, little boy?"

The giantess's lips parted open wide, showing her young victim his possible next destination. The size of the giantess’s mouth frightened poor little Jack. The maw was like a cave deep under the sea, dark and wet where hardly any light shone inside its deeper darkness. Her tongue was like a giant pink serpent waiting for its next victim to devour, and the incisor teeth were the size of an executioner’s axe. Worse was the abyssal throat which led down to the boiling cauldron of the giantess’s stomach where her food dissolved underneath their burning juices.

“Please don’t eat me, Miss Giant!” Jack begged, cowering in the fist of his captor.

"Oh, I cannot guarantee that, little human boy. You see, I enjoy the consumption of those who are no bigger than the size of my hand, and little worms such as yourselves are no exception," the giantess said, whipping out her signature battle axe and striking the handle into the cloudy ground. Suddenly, her teasing seemed to have dissipated like sugar in water. "I am Marsha Laejotunn, your captor and your executioner. You have trespassed onto my home and I can only guess you wanted to steal my vegetables from my servants' garden or treasure within my home."

"N-No, Miss Giant, please, I was just..." The giantess squeezed her fist, choking Jack and stopping his defense.

"Silence, you little worm! You should not have come here so foolishly!" Marsha bellowed in Jack's face like thunder. "Many who have foolishly ventured onto my home have met similar fates. They were sliced apart by my axe, stamped beneath my mighty feet, or met their doom in the darkness of my stomach. Some have tried to escape, but they all had one thing in common, little worm: They have all failed, and for that, their lives have ended by my hand."

"P-Please..." Jack wheezed, his lungs feeling like they were collapsing, tears squeezed from his eyes.

"Now how shall I best punish a bug such as yourself?" Marsha rhetorically asked her young victim, wiggling the toes of her boots. "I suppose I could crush you under my feet. It seems fitting, seeing as you are the perfect size for it.

"Or..." Marhsa continued, moving Jack up over her face, shifting her hand so she pinched Jack at the back of his tunic, "I could always swallow you. You may be only a tiny morsel, but you've caught me during my breakfast, so you should be a part of it as well." For the second time, the barbaric giantess opened her maw and showed the dark, dank cave of her maw, blowing a hot gust of breath that made the boy wiggle frantically in her grasp.

"Or..." Marsha wondered, bringing Jack down to the level of her face, tilting her head and spreading a frightening grin on her beautiful face, "I could always keep you for my slave. I have a bunch of other tiny slaves who serve their mistress without question, and having one more couldn't hurt. Maybe you'll be better off as my insole, inside my loins, or as my toy, I'm sure I can find a better use for you."

The armored giantess pinched the back of Jack's tunic tightly while the boy in question slowed his struggles down as he realized the futility of it all. He realized that no matter what he did, the giantess would have the upper hand. Alongside her strength and size, Marsha also displayed a clear sense of pride and dominance towards him and anyone else his size and age. He was nothing but a bug, an edible morsel, or even a toy for his gigantic captor. Whatever happened to him was up to Marsha Laejotunn, the devourer and dominator giant warrior woman.

What happens next?

1.) Marsha drops Jack on the ground and crushes him under her foot (he survives, but is flattened against her sole!)

2.) Marsha drops Jack into her mouth and swallows him whole (he survives, but is trapped inside her stomach!)

3.) Marsha brings Jack in as her own personal slave (he meets other young people of the realm who have been forced into slavery).

4.) Jack attempts to reason with the giantess to spare his life and his freedom.

5.) Jack escapes Marsha's grasp, but he must make it to the beanstalk with Marsha in pursuit!
15412.title: The Mean, Muscular Giantess

1543.content:
In the original Gulliver’s Travels novel by Jonathan Swift, Lemuel Gulliver washes up on the shores of Lilliput, a country inhabited by tiny of the Lilliputian Royal Court and is given permission by the King of Lilliput to go around the city on condition that he must not hurt their subjects. However, the Lilliputians are weary of Gulliver's dangerous giant size, and Gulliver discovers that the Lilliputians often emphasize on trivial matters which causes rifts within the kingdom.

At some point, Gulliver assists Lilliput in their war against the rival country of similarly tiny people, Blefuscu, but Gulliver refuses to convert Blefuscu into a province for Lilliput. He is charged with treason and sentenced to be blinded, but he escapes with the help of a friend to Blefuscu where they prepare a boat for him to sail to sea where a passing ship spots him and carries him back home.

In later chapters, Gulliver washes up on the shores of Brobdingnag, a country inhabited by giants where he is cared for by the young Brobdingnagian girl, Glumdalclitch. He is later brought before the Queen of Brobdingnag, who commissions accommodations for Gulliver's tiny (to them) stature in the form of a box carried around by Glumdalclitch.

In this story route, we'll be exploring different routes based around the major size-related plot points of Gulliver's Travels. In the Lilliput route, we'll be exploring a woman sharing the Gulliver surname washed up on the Lilliputian beach but discovered by young Lilliputian boys. In the Brobdingnag route, we'll be exploring a young human boy or a Lilliputian boy who washes on the shore of Brobdingnag and is found by a girl named Glumdalclitch. In the third option, we'll be exploring a world which is a mix of the different giant/tiny/human-sized cultures from the novel.

(A/N: You can determine if the story routes takes place in the 18th century setting of the novel, or the modern-day 21st century setting.)

The only question is, which route will you choose?

Lilliput

Brobdingnag

-or-

Mixture of Different Cultures
1543.title: Gulliver's Travels

155.content:
Since the early 1920's, comic strips were printed in the newspapers for entertainment. As the years rolled by, the comic strips eventually earned their own comic book magazine, and the earliest big comic book company to emerge was DC Comics. In the early 1960's, the first Fantastic Four comic issue marked the debut of Marvel Comics. These two major comic book companies have become two of the biggest names in the comic book history, creating iconic heroes, villains, and influential storylines.

Other major comic book companies, while overshadowed by the competitiveness of DC and Marvel, have published their own iconic comic books as well, such as Archie from Archie Comics, and Spawn and Invincible from Image Comics to name a few.

For the sake of argument and variety within the Comic Books route, which of these comic book companies will you choose?

DC Comics (featuring Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman, and the Justice League)

Marvel (featuring Spider-Man, The Avengers, The Fantastic Four, and the X-Men)

Image Comics (featuring Spawn, Youngblood, etc.)

-or-

Archie Comics (featuring Archie, Sabrina the Teenage Witch, Josie and the Pussycats)
155.title: Comic Books or Graphic Novels

1551.content:
DC Comics is one of the oldest comic book companies in the world, notable for its fictional locations such as Metropolis and Gotham City, its heroes such as Superman, Batman, and Wonder Woman, and villains such as the Joker, Lex Luthor, and the Cheetah.

In this route, we will be focusing on certain boy characters appearing in the DC Universe, either as a canon character such as Damian Wayne (a.k.a. Robin), or an original character of your choice within the canon DC Universe. They will be shrunken, born tiny, or every woman in the DC Comics is bigger than the normal-sized character. The only question is, is the focus character from the DC Comics or an original character?
1551.title: DC Comics

15511.content:
The focus boy character is a character canon to the DC Universe.

Choose one of the following characters you want to focus on...

Damian Wayne/Robin IV: The biological son of Bruce Wayne/Batman, and Talia al Ghul, daughter to the leader of the League of Assassins, Ra’s al Ghul. A result of impregnation, Damian is trained from birth by the elite group of assassins and has inherited much of his father's broodiness. He has taken up the mantle as the fourth Robin, but unlike his previous three successors, Damian hardly has any sense of humor.

Jonathan Kent/Superboy: The biological son of Clark Kent/Superman and Lois Lane, the Pulitzer Prize-winning reporter of the Daily Planet. Jonathan is born half-Kryptonian, meaning he inherited his father’s abilities which is awakened under the yellow sun. He and Damian often go on strange and fantastic adventures, often serving as Damian's foil to his broodiness.

Billy Batson/Captain Marvel: The son of two archaeologists who were killed during their final expedition by their partner, Teth-Adam, who would later become the Khandaq dictator Black Adam. Taking the subway to the Rock of Eternity, Billy Batson was chosen as a champion of the residing wizard and is bestowed the ability to transform into the mighty Captain Marvel by shouting “SHAZAM!” He lives in a foster home with foster siblings his age, including his twin sister, Mary, who all gain Billy's abilities by shouting "SHAZAM!"

-or-

Garfield Logan/Beast Boy: The son of two jungle explorers who, during an expedition, he was bitten by an infected green monkey, which gave him the ability to transform into the animal kingdom, but also turned his ears and hair green. After his parents died in a boating accident, Beast Boy was taken in by the Doom Patrol and found a family in his team, later joining the Teen Titans as its youngest member.
15511.title: Canon

choices: The Shrunken Son of Man's World
15512.content:
The focus main boy character is an original character and non-canon to the main DC Comics storyline.

Choose one of these story routes you want to focus on...

The Shrunken Son of Man's World: The boy is on a passenger flight overseas with his family as it flew over the Bermuda Triangle, which was experiencing a strange lightning storm. The storm also sent out strange electromagnetic pulses, which activated the boy's meta-gene, shrinking him down to the size of one-inch right before the lightning struck the plane. The lightning also struck the window of his seat, sucking the boy out into the sea as the plane crashed down into the sea. He eventually drifts to the shores of Themyscira, home to the Amazons and Wonder Woman!

The Son of a Super-Villainess: The boy is not biologically related to the villainesses appearing in this route, but born to a couple of scientists working in STAR Labs. Born tiny because of his parents' continued exposure to the radiation of STAR Labs technology and the fumes of the experimental chemicals, the boy made the national headlines for his abnormal size. The STAR Labs scientists hired a nanny to watch over the boy, not knowing that the nanny in question was an infamous villainess who kidnapped him in his sleep and raised him. The boy's future as hero or villain in ambiguous.

The Katarthan Kid: The boy is a member of the Katarthans, a six-inch race of alien humanoids who crash-landed in the Amazon Rainforest seen in the six-issue miniseries, Sword of the Atom. When the Katarthans were eradicated by a fireball during a fight between Ray Palmer/The Atom II and seven Brazilian drug runners, the Katarthan boy was the only survivor. He wandered the Amazon rainforest for many weeks until he came across a giant woman, either a native Brazilian or a foreign visitor.

-or-
