The Black Fly: The boy is a troubled delinquent who took to snatching in the streets of Washington D.C. and evaded police. In order to make a better living, the boy joins the museum tour of the Justice League's Hall of Justice and decides to steal and sell off the collected trophies of the League's various adventures, including Atomica's malfunctioning shrinking belt. That night, the boy sneaks into the Hall of Justice and snatches a few of the trophies, but he is discovered by the female members of the League, so he uses the shrinking belt to escape, only to be permanently shrunk. He is either caught and at the mercy of the Justice League giantesses, or he escapes but is sought by the giant villainesses.
15512.title: Non-Canon

155121.content:
The Shrunken Son of Man's World

Character Bios

Name: Timmy Walker
Age: 8 years old
Eyes: Blue
Hair: Black
Height: 3' 9"
Weight: 103 lbs.
Ethnicity: White/Caucasian
Backstory: Timmy Walker is born to his mother, Michelle Walker, a father, and two older brothers. During spring break, the Walker family decided they were going to fly from their hometown in Florida to Italy for the week. Unfortunately, their flight path takes them through the Bermuda Triangle, an area infamous for the disappearances of different airplanes and ships, and is protected by a mystical lightning storm. This lightning storm will not only change Timmy's fate, but also his small size as well.

Main Story:
The Walker family was ready to board the flight to their overseas destination to Italy. Michelle Walker, the matriarch of the Walker family, was taking her husband and her three sons to Italy for their spring break. Michelle and her husband was excited to explore the beautiful Italian countryside to see the beautiful sights and tourist attractions. The older two brothers were excited to explore the pretty girls of Italy and vainly attempt to swoon them with their fake Italian accents. Eight year-old Timmy, the youngest member of the family, was excited to try out the food.

Timmy was the youngest and the most energetic member of his family, having a strong penchant for food at his age. Where Where China had been the country to invent noodles, Italy was the place where they perfected it into all kinds of pastas, pizzas, and soups, and Timmy couldn't wait to try them all out. Their flight path went from Florida to an international airport in Italy, directly over the Atlantic Ocean.

What they would find over a certain area was certain doom, because the flight paths went over the Bermuda Tringle, an area off the coast of Florida where strong electromagnetic fields conjured up strong lightning storms and made any magnetic instrument go haywire. The worst part were the mysterious disappearances of different ships and aircrafts reported over the years. Then again, in recent years, those reports of disappearing transports diminished, and the dangers of the Bermuda Triangle were mostly forgotten and scrubbed away. No one could ever predict what would happen to Flight 407 to Italy.

It happened two hours after the airplane took off the runway. The flight was relatively peaceful, people conversing with each other, kids squirming in their seats or preoccupied with their handheld game consoles. In Timmy's case, he was the only kid on the plane playing his Nintendo 3DS, sitting in the window seat while his mother and father took the middle and aisle seats respectively. He was totally engrossed in his game, and the only things that would normally snap him out of his reverie were refreshments, a bathroom break, a movie, and when his DS's battery ran out.

Midway through this ill-fated flight, a strong pounding sensation, a consistent shuddering, and flickering lights snapped Timmy out of it, scaring him and all the other passengers onboard. Timmy turned to the window and saw nothing but dark clouds and the strobing flashes of lightning. Suddenly, he felt his body tingle all over, like every muscle in his body fell asleep and was accompanied with the prickly nerve sensation. He whimpered as he quickly diminished in his seat, he and his clothes shrinking in his seat, loosening the seatbelt. Michelle gasped at the sight of her son shrinking before her eyes... and Timmy could only look up to his now-giant mother for salvation.

"Mommy?"

All of a sudden, a bolt of lightning struck his window, shattering it and causing the air pressure to get sucked out and everything else small enough to fit along with it. Timmy screamed as he tried to hold on to his seatbelt. Before Michelle could reach him, Timmy's grip on the leather slipped and he was sucked into the open air, falling miles above the Atlantic just as another lightning bolt struck the plane's engines. The plane went down with one of the engines blazing like an apocalyptic fireball, crashing into the ocean the same time Timmy merely plunked into the water.

The boy quickly surfaced into the turbulent ocean waters and watched helplessly as the plane sunk into the ocean, taking everyone inside with it. Timmy cried for his mommy just as a wave dragged him under the surface, pulling him down with the pressure. Between his tiny size and the ocean's heavy pressure, all Timmy could do was try to swim back up to the surface, but he was too weak against everything else. His struggles led to physical soreness, then to mental fatigue, and then finally, loss of consciousness. Before he blacked out, he vaguely saw giant feminine shapes in the water swimming towards him.

Do not fear child. It is not your time, yet, a soothing motherly voice gently spoke to him.

The next thing Timmy knew, he was hacking up saltwater from his lungs. After he hacked up the last of the seawater, Timmy looked around and saw only a beach, but appearing more gigantic to his shrunken size. He stood up in the sand, feeling the sand's grit stronger grit against his feet, and looked out into the ocean. He stared out into the vast ocean waters underneath the bright, blue, and partly cloudy skies and fell into a fetal position. Then everything came crashing down on him as he began to cry, wailing for the death of his family, for the death of his mommy, and for the traumatic event he was forced to endure. He was alone and stranded on this island, and he could never get his family back.

Then came the noise of someone striding the sands, accompanied by the slight tremors with each stride. Timmy broke away from his mourning and turned to the direction of the sound. The person (or people) approaching his area was a giant woman by his size! This giantess was none other than...
155121.title: The Shrunken Son of Man's World

1551211.content:
The giantess is Princess Diana of Themyscira (a.k.a. Wonder Woman).

This route is divided between Princess Diana before and after she takes the mantle of Themyscira's Champion.

The only question is, which route will you choose:

Before Wonder Woman: Princess Diana of Themyscira often wanders the shores of Themyscira, wishing and praying to the Greek gods of legend that there would be more to the world outside the mystic barriers surrounding Paradise Island than within. One day, she spots a giant metal bird crashing into the oceans far off the shores with a wing going down in flames like Icarus. It is only at the shores that she spots the shrunken Son of Man's World, but his gender is forbidden from entering the shores, so she either hides him or brings this matter to her mother, Queen Hippolyta.

After Wonder Woman: Princess Diana of Themyscira recently received word of Flight 407 to Italy passing over the Bermuda Triangle, prompting her to leave her home in Boston and investigate the plane crash not far from the shores of her home island. She finds no survivors in the seawater, as the guarding megalodons already feasted on them, save for one shrunken Son of Man's World washed up on the shores of Themyscira. Wonder Woman will take the tiny boy as her own, either allowing herself or one of her female allies to watch over him.
1551211.title: Diana/Wonder Woman

15512111.content:
(For reference: https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/...)

Princess Diana of Themyscira was special, not because she was a god-gifted homunculus of clay with a soul, or because she was the daughter of Queen Hippolyta, but because she was destined for more. On Paradise Island, there was hardly any corruption or war, but Diana felt there was something for her outside the forbidden mystic barriers surrounding the island with never ending storm clouds. She could feel it stirring deep within her very essence.

That feeling came to light when she spotted what looked like a giant metal bird crashing into the oceans far off the shores of Themyscira. It fell like any bird would fall when pierced with an arrow mid-air, except one of its wings was burning alight Icarus's wings before the blazing sun. It fell into Poseidon's wrathful waters with a mighty splash. Her mother, Queen Hippolyta, would often tell Diana of tales when she returned to Man's World to aid in a bloody worldwide war, and one of those tales was of giant metal birds transporting anyone within its belly into the air and across the waters of the world. Diana couldn't help but bow her head and say a little prayer to the gods to deliver their souls into peace while their bodies were fed to the guarding megalodons.

As Diana witnessed the bird being slowly claimed by the sea, her peripheral vision caught something unusual crawling from the crashing waters on the shores. Gifted with the eyes of Artemis, Goddess of the Hunt and the Moon, Diana squinted her eyes and got a better look. On the shores was the tiny shape of a person laying in the sands in the position of a baby's fetus. The person was small... perhaps it was a child? From what she could see based on the child's shuddering, he was crying. Perhaps the small child was the only survivor of the metal bird’s demise, and traversed through Poseidon’s waters only to wash up on the shores of Themyscira.

“Great Hera. He's all alone,” Diana whispered as she quickly strode over to him.

While Timmy had wept, he picked up the hearing of someone striding the sands, accompanied by the slight tremors with each stride. Timmy broke away from his mourning and turned to the direction of the sound. The person approaching his area was a giant woman by his size! This giantess was a beautiful woman with creamy skin, and hair as black as night pulled into a single braided ponytail. She wore a leather breastplate and metal bracelets on her wrists reaching just below her forearms. Around her waist, she wore a belt with a scabbard sheathed with a sword, holding up a short beige skirt, and knee-high leather gladiator sandals worn on her immaculate feet.

Timmy watched the giantess approach his location. He saw her eyes meeting his tiny stature, he saw how she towered over him, and he began to panic. He quickly got up on his feet and ran as fast as his aching muscles could take him, screaming all the way. “He’s afraid of me,” Diana deduced as she began to pursue him, her strides quickly making up ground. “Little one, wait! Do not be afraid! I have not come to harm you!”

But the tiny panicking boy wouldn’t listen. Driven by his flight response, Timmy ran as fast as his tiny legs would let him. The booming vibrations of the giantess’s feet behind him began to grow bigger and more powerful as she quickly caught up with him. Then all of a sudden, a sandaled foot crashed at his heel, creating a shocking tremor that knocked him off his feet and land face-first into the sand. Before he could quickly recover, a pair of giant ivory hands gently scooped him up along with a handful of sand beneath him and lifted him up to her face.

The tiny boy whimpered and scrambled as the sand beneath him drained from the cracks between the cracks of the giantess’s palms and fingers. Past the waist, the belly, and the breasts, Timmy was lifted to the giantess’s beautiful face. Her blue eyes stared down on him like a goddess, judging his every action leading up to now. Timmy felt the fear overwhelm him and he began to cry.

“Please, don’t hurt me! I don’t wanna die!” Timmy begged, which made the giantess pout pitifully.

“Don’t cry, little one, I’m not going to hurt you,” Diana assured as she gently brought her other hand to comfort the boy. Timmy whimpered and curled in her palm, preparing for the inevitable moment when she might crush him. Instead, he felt the giantess’s fingers gently stroke him on the back, the same way his mother used to when he needed her comfort.

"It is okay, little one. There is no need to cry, I would never harm a child,” Diana cooed, gently stroking the tiny child’s back. She could feel him shivering like he was cold from the water, except he was shuddering out of fear. “My name is Diana. I am the princess of the Amazons of Themyscira, to which you have washed upon its shores. What is your name?”

The tiny boy sniffed and choked, wiping his wet nose with his arm. “M-M-My name is T-T-Timmy, M-Miss Giant. Timmy W-Walker.”

“It is a pleasure to meet you, Timmy. And please, call me Diana,” the giantess said softly and gently the same way her mother used to talk to her when she was his age. “Timmy, I know this may be painful for you to talk about, but were you one of the people who survived the demise of that giant metal bird?”

"Giant... metal bird...?" Timmy turned to the oceans, and he knew what the giantess, Diana referred to. "Yes. My family and I were... were flying all the way from Florida to Italy for a family vacation. W-We were flying, and then we flew into the storm, and then... and..."

The memories of that traumatic even came flooding back in flashes, the mental images of his miniaturization and what happened afterwards making him cry harder. “Th-th-the plane started rumbling, and I somehow got smaller and smaller! Then the light hit my window and I got sucked out of the plane! Then when I was fuh-fuh-falling, th-the plane was hit by the lightning again, and it went down into the ocean! I tried to swim, but I was pulled down underwater and... and...!"

Timmy remembered what he saw next, the images of the plane crashing into the ocean with a flaming wing as clear as crystal, taking his family with him into the depths of Davy Jones' Locker. The shrunken boy screamed and wailed at the fates of his family, and fell into the soft comfort of Diana's palm. "Oh, Timmy, I am so sorry for your loss and for your predicament,” Diana consoled the boy, "but do not worry, young one, because you are not alone now."

“But I am alone!” Timmy wailed. “I lost my mommy! I lost my brothers! I don’t have a family anymore! I’ll never get to see them again!”

Diana gently shushed the boy as she clenched her fist gently and held him close to her chest. With her thumb, she gently ruffled his hair, massaging his scalp as he released his inner turmoil into her bosom. Such a cruel fate for a child, Diana figures, to be shrunken down by the same mystical barrier used to protect this island and to lose his family all at once. This boy was small enough to be stepped on or eaten like a little morsel. He needed guidance, and he needed a mother. Unfortunately, Aphrodite's Law dictated that no man should set foot on this island, and this son of Man's World was no exception.

Then she thought of something on the spot, but it was going to be risky.

1.) Diana takes him back to her secret hiding area in the grotto.
2.) Diana takes him to her mother, Queen Hippolyta, for guidance.
15512111.title: Before Wonder Woman

choices: An Afternoon Nap with the Queen
1551212.content:
Hippolyta: https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/wond...

Hippolyta, Queen of the Amazons, has governed over her sisters since the times of the Ancient Greek legends of Heracles. For many millennia, Hippolyta has watched over Paradise Island, risen from the bottom of the Pacific Ocean by the Greek gods and protected with a powerful ward from any outside forces. She was the one who crafted her daughter, Diana, from a clay baby and brought to life by the blessings of the gods. She was the one who taught her most of life's most valuable lessons, but was reluctant to teach her the arts of fighting and war.

This was until the male soldier, Steven Rockwell Trevor, crashed his aircraft on the shores of Themyscira, and then everything changed. The man was to be escorted back into Man's World, and only the winner of the fated tournament she arranged would be the one to do it. Against her mother's wishes, Diana won the tournament and was tasked with the burden to take Steve back into Man's World where they revered her as the iconic heroine she is today. This memory was sparked as Hippolyta witnessed the fiery crash of Flight 407 within the perimeter of the powerful storm wards. Dressed in her finest fuchsia robes, Hippolyta quickly raced to the shores and watched the carrier plane sink into Poseidon's cruel waters, and dipped her head in prayer.

"O Hades, god of the underworld, please allow Charon to ferry the poor souls aboard that flying vessel across the River Styx, and let them be at peace within the heavenly fields of Elysium," Hippolyta whispered, a tear shed for each man, woman, and even child aboard the crashed flight. It didn't take much to know that no one could have survived that crash, nor could they avoid the jaws of the megalodons guarding the waters.

And as Hippolyta spent a moment of silence for those who suffered an unfortunate fate, she heard a sniffle... a whimper of a youth. It was very faint, almost like the squeaking of a mouse. She followed her ears to that sound and beheld a saddened sight. It appeared to a child, curled up into a fetal position, grieving for whoever he lost in that vessel. The voice alone confirmed that the child was the son of Man's World. Curiously and surprisingly, the boy was as small as a little seashell! Hippolyta knew the fear of his shrunken size also factored in his weeping. She needed to do something, and she needed to be quick about it, for not only were the beasts of the island would be large enough to gobble him up and the Amazons to accidentally crush him where they stepped, but he was violating Aprohidte's Law upon her people!

Setting her staff down, Hippolyta quickly strode towards the shrunken boy.

While Timmy had wept, he picked up the hearing of someone striding the sands, accompanied by the slight tremors with each stride. Timmy broke away from his mourning and turned to the direction of the sound. The person approaching his area was a giant woman by his size! This giantess was a beautiful woman with creamy skin, and hair as black as night curled like campfire smoke, some of the longer strands curled up in a ponytail. She wore fuchsia robes which bore the size and flow of a theater curtain, and was adorned in a gold belt, and old accessories on her ears and around her neck. Gladiator sandal-clad feet poked from underneath the robes, headed right for him!

Timmy's panic and flight instincts took over as he screamed and ran away from the approaching giantess. "Wait! Little one, wait!" the giantess implored the young shrinkee. "Do not be afraid, little one! I am not trying to harm you!"

But the tiny panicking boy wouldn’t listen. Driven by his flight response, Timmy ran as fast as his tiny legs would let him. The booming vibrations of the giantess’s feet behind him began to grow bigger and more powerful as she quickly caught up with him. Then all of a sudden, a shadow loomed over him as the giantess's left sandaled foot stepped over his tiny frame, landing a ways ahead of him with a boom, enveloping him in fuchsia shadow. On his right, the giantess's right foot stopped shortly ahead of him. Timmy screamed as he was trapped in the shadow underneath the giantess, unable to see, unable to find his way out.

Two additional quakes rocked him from within the darkness. Then a doorway in the darkness lifted into light, and a giant feminine hand adorned in a metallic bracelet reached in, quickly curling a set of five fingers around his tiny frame. Timmy's panic upgraded into hysterics as the giantess held him in her fist and brought him out into the light, lifting him up to her worried face. Hippolyta frowned at the sight of the panicking tiny boy in her palm, stricken by Phobos and overwhelmed with grief.

"Please, Miss Giant, don't hurt me!" Timmy begged, curling up his body and turning to the side.

"Please, child, be at peace. I do not have the desire to harm the son of Man's World, even if he is quite small," Hippolyta gently assured the boy. She gently pet her fingers against Timmy's body, who flinched at the touch at first, but settled under it. "You were aboard the vessel, were you not, child? You were somehow shrunken in the process and ended up on the shores of Themyscira. The fates have not been so kind to you, child."

Timmy sniffled into his sleeve, and sat up in the middle of Hippolyta's giant palm. He built enough courage to stare into the giant queen's eyes, who looked down on him with pity and sympathy. "It is alright, child. I promise no harm will come to you on Themyscira," Hippolyta gently assured, using the same assuring voice she used when Diana was the boy's age. "I am Hippolyta, queen of the Amazons and of this island you were washed upon. Can you tell me where you are from and how you came to be this way?”

Timmy nodded, whimpering. “T-Timmy, your majesty. T-Timmy Walker,” the bite-sized boy answered. "I-I was flying with my family over the ocean to Italy when... when... when a scary storm hit the plane! I don’t know what happened, but I shrunk to this size and I was sucked out of the plane! I fell into the water and I tried to swim but I was so tired, I couldn’t swim anymore! Then I woke up on the beach all alone and... and...”

Timmy couldn’t hold back the urge to cry as he buried his face in his hands. “They’re gone! They’re gone and I can never see them again! I’ll never see my big brothers again! I’ll never see my daddy again! I’ll never see my mommy again!”

While Timmy wept in the queen’s hand, keeling over letting tears flow from his eyes, Hippolyta couldn’t help but feel heartbroken for the poor boy. With her other hand, she gently stroked Timmy’s back, cradling him in her gentle grasp. “I am sorry, little one. This is a fate you did not deserve to suffer from. I can never imagine the pain of your loss and the terror of being so small compared to the rest of the world.”

Timmy sniffled and choked. “I miss them so much!”

"I know, young one. Your grief speaks of it in volumes," Hippolyta answered. She could only watch as the boy poured out his devastations in the palm of her hand, feeling as if he needed someone else in his life, someone who needed a mother more than anything else in the world. "Timmy, I know this may sound so sudden now, but your presence here on this island goes against our rules stating that no men is to enter these shores. Even though you are a child, Timmy, you are still a man."

Timmy continued to weep, his head drooped down in sorrow. A giant gentle index finger lifted his chin and met with Hippolyta's gentle eyes. "But there is still a way for me to bypass this law," the gentle giantess said softly. "If any man is willing to remain on this island, then the man must be bound to an Amazon in servitude. The man will serve the Amazon well, but in accordance to Aphrodite's Law, we must also provide them food, shelter, and comfort in the name of love."

"What... what does that mean?" Timmy asked.

"It means, child, that since you have no family to turn to on Themyscira, you will be living here with me," Hippolyta clarified. "You will have to do what I ask of you in exchange for food and a place to live, but I am sure they will be simple for you, given your current size. I cannot in good conscience ask of you got me to replace the mother you lost, but all I ask is you let me take care of you, nurture you, and encourage your journey to growing into a man. Do you accept this?"

Timmy sniffled, wiping his wet nose again, and nodding his head. "Mm-hmm."

"Good Now hold out your fists to me." Timmy held out his fists, just as the queen ordered him to. "Turn them over."

Timmy overturned his arms, showing the underside of his fists. Hippolyta gently laid her gigantic hand over Timmy's arms, and suddenly, her bracelet glowed as a little drop of light trickled onto his wrists. The light wrapped around the wrists and faded, giving Timmy a pair of metal bracelets just like the giantess said. "Now you are bound to me, young Timmy Walker. As long as you are bound to me, no harm may come of you, nor shall any Amazon attempt to break it. When you are in distress, these bracelets will glow, indicating you are in trouble. In exchange, you will need to do as you are told, but the tasks I will assign you will accommodate your youth and size. Do you understand?"

"Y-Yes, your majesty," Timmy stuttered.

"Very good," Hippolyta nodded. "Come, let us retire. You must be weary from your struggles and you must rest. Allow me to carry you."

So Hippolyta reached dress, and gently inserted Timmy into her cleavage. After securing him in her breasts, the Queen of the Amazons took her staff and marched towards the city.

What happens next?

1.) Timmy and Hippolyta reaches the palace without incident and they retire for the afternoon.
2.) Timmy and Hippolyta reaches the city, but Timmy slips out of her cleavage and lands somewhere in the streets.
1551212.title: Queen Hippolyta

choices: Dinner with the Amazon High Council
A Kid Napping During a Kidnapping!
15512121.content:
Queen Hippolyta marched through the city, her newly-appointed young charge hidden between her breasts. Timmy's face burned bright red as his new giant caretaker strolled through the ivory streets of the Themysciran city, embarrassed by the fact he was restrained between his adopted mother's breasts which bobbed and bounced with each new taken step.

He was obscured behind the hem of Hippolyta's fuchsia gown, keeping him hidden from the eyes of the Amazon Queen's fellow sisters. Hippolyta knew they'd frown upon the idea of allowing a man to stay on Paradise Island, no matter how young he was, and they would frown deeper upon learning that their queen had bound him to her service. Hippolyta would have to explain it later once she reached the palace, feeling the tiny bulk of his frame held in her cleavage, keeping him tightly close to her chest.

Over the hem of the gown, Timmy peeked and observed the city filled with women, all of them around his late mother's age. They were all dressed in similar robes, gowns, and togas, and every one of them engaged in their mundane routine and minding their business. He was quite surprised to see how the women stopped and revered at the sight of their Queen passing them, exclaiming their courteous greetings to her, and the Queen herself returned those courtesies with a smile and a nod. A few Amazons approached her like a good friend and asked her for her review on botanical arrangements, hunting, fishing, and the arts. Each time, Hippolyta gently replied she would review their questions for another time and excused herself to retire for the afternoon. With every step she took, Hippolyta's breasts bounced, rocking the tiny Timmy between them to Morpheus's slumbering bliss.

Hippolyta reached her castle and ascended her stairs, guarded at the bottom and the top by her finest soldiers. As soon as she strolled inside the entrance, she was greeted by two of her most trusted soldiers and friends: Phillipus, a dark-skinned Amazon and general of the Amazonian army, and Artemis, the fierce red-haired warrior of the Amazons.

"My Queen," the two Amazons bowed to Hippolyta.

"My sisters," Hippolyta addressed them.

"Is there anything to report to the high council regarding the flying vessel beyond our shores?" Phillipus inquired, to which the Queen sadly shook her head.

"Nay, Phillipus, the aircraft has been struck down by the protective wards and has been claimed by the sea," Hippolyta said regretfully. "To my knowledge, no one would have survived this horrific accident... no one, save for this..." Hippolyta reached into her chest, gently pinched the tiny carrier in her cleavage up, and brought a curled fist to her most trusted allies. She uncurled her fingers, and in the center of the palm laid the miniscule figure of Timmy Walker, curled up as he slept some of his physical exhaustion off.

"My Queen, what is this?" Artemis asked, clearly surprised by the revelation along with Phillipus.

"This is the son of Man's World who only survived because of the protective ward's effect on him," Hippolyta explained. "I do not know exactly what has become of his family who was aboard the craft or how he bypassed the megalodons, but young Timmy Walker here has been shrunken to his current size, washed up on the shores of Themyscira alone, and is in dire need of a family."

"My Queen, Aphrodite's Law clearly states that no man is to set foot on the island, even one so young such as him!" the ebony Amazon pointed out. "To allow any man on the island is to defy the will of the gods! He cannot be allowed to longer, you know this!"

"I do, Phillipus, and your concern is duly noted," Hippolyta replied, "however, there is another part of the law to which you have also forgotten. Should any man wish to remain on this island, they would be bound to serve an Amazon. Though he is quite young, the boy has no one else to turn to, and I have already establish his bond of servitude to me."

Phillipus and Artemis looked closer, and they saw the same metal bracelets the Amazons were bound to on his wrists as well. "The boy is now bound to his servitude to me, which means his life belongs to me as well," Hippolyta continued. "He may be a man, but he is still a child, and it is the Amazon's nature to encourage the growth of children and to protect them out of love, much like how we raised Diana into the finest warrior in the world."

“But, my Queen...”

“That is enough, Phillipus,” Hippolyta interjected, raising her hand. “I have made my decision. I will be in my chambers to accommodate the boy to my chambers. The trauma he has endured today has drained him of his energy, so I will allow him to rest until the morning when his service to me officially starts."

The motions and the noise were enough to stir Timmy awake in his spot within the giant queen's palm. He rubbed his eyes, heaved a mighty, and sat up in the middle of the warm, leathery platform. He fluttered his eyes open, and was immediately frightened by the sight of two giant fierce-looking women beyond his caretaker's semi-truck-sized fingers.

"Ahh!" Timmy screamed, curling up instinctively. "Please don't hurt me!"

"Be at peace, child, they will not harm you," Hippolyta gently cooed, daintily rubbing Timmy's shuddering frame with her free fingers. The fearful shaking eventually stopped under the giantess's gentle strokes, and Timmy felt compelled to crawl to the edge of her fingers and get a better look at the women who scared him. "These are my most loyal soldiers and sisters, Phillipus and Artemis. Do not let the way they look at you frighten you, young Timmy; you will come to see they have a tender heart beneath their fierce demeanor."

"That remains to be seen," Artemis grumbled, giving Timmy a slight glare, which made him hide behind the queen's monolithic fingers.

"My Queen, I only hope you know what you are doing with this child," Phillipus asked, fearful of the gods' wrath that would be inflicted upon the island, and concerned for the well-being of her Queen and her decision. "The boy must prove his worth of being under our personal charge. If he cannot prove himself, then by the laws bestowed onto us, we would have to force him off the island by way of the sea."

"I do, Phillipus," Hippolyta confirmed, stroking Timmy's back gently like a baby bird, "but you mustn't fear, my love, because we will show him the ways of the Amazon and encourage him to follow on the righteous path, and I will count on you and Artemis to help discipline him should he falter in his tasks." Hippolyta brought her forehead against Phillipus's forehead and looked into each other's eyes intimately. "Please trust me, Phillipus, this is what's best for the child."

"I do trust you, my Queen," Phillipus said with a low volume, "but I pray that the boy does not end up like all the other men who have failed in the past."

"Then we will make it an effort to make sure it never happens. You and Artemis are dismissed."

"Yes, my Queen."

With a bow, the two giantesses turned and exited the palace, leaving Hippolyta and Timmy alone as they were headed for the Queen's chambers.

"The lady with the red hair scares me," Timmy said meekly, making a Hippolyta chuckle.

“It is natural that she is intimidating. After all, she’s the fiercest warrior among us now,” she said, gently stroking her new charge’s back as she entered the chambers and placed him on the nightstand. "Now, Timmy, I want you to understand that what you heard between me and Phillipus is the truth. I cannot guarantee all of the tasks will be easy given your youth, stature, and inexperience, but every task is to help the betterment of your maturity. If you want to stay among the Amazons, you must complete these tasks and you will earn your place among the Amazons, even as a persona servant or pet. Do you understand?"

"Yes, your majesty," Timmy answered.

"Good." Hippolyta retrieved a birdcage, clean and stainless, and stuffed it with a two sacks of fluff, one resembling a pillow and another resembling a mattress, and a tiny scrap of a weighted cloth. "Now, my young charge, this is where you will be sleeping from now on. You may rest here and allow your weariness to pass until tonight's feast. I will personally introduce you to the Amazon high council and address your bond to me."

Timmy groaned, not just tiredly but also worriedly. "What if they don't like me?"

"They will have mixed feelings about your arrival, for certain," Hippolyta answered, "but they will come to love you in their own time. I cannot force the Amazons to love my children simply because they are the children of their Queen. It is up to them to decide whether they will accept you as one of our own or not.. and I do hope, dear child, they do not reject you simply for being the son of Man's World."

"Why?"

"That, my young charge, is a story for a different time." Hippolyta opened the cage door, tilted her palm so Timmy would step off into the interior, and reached inside to gently tuck him in for his afternoon slumber. "Now get some rest, young one. If there is anything you need, I won't be far away."

"Okay." Timmy finished with a cute yawn as he allowed the giantess to tuck him into his new bed. It wasn't like his bed back home, but it was certainly more comfortable. Hippolyta closed the door and watched as her new adopted son slept, smiling at how peaceful he looked despite the nightmares he had lived through. She laid down on her bed and looked out the window to the sea, cursing the wards surrounding the offshores of Themiscyra for putting the young child through so much pain. Her eyes fluttered to sleep, allowing Morpheus to take her into the world of dreams.

What happens next?

1.) Timmy and Hippolyta wake up for dinner with the Amazon high council.
2.) Someone sneaks into Hiipolyta's chambers and kidnaps Timmy in his sleep!
3.) The Olympian goddesses appear to test Timmy's size and courage!
15512121.title: An Afternoon Nap with the Queen

choices: Hippolyta excuses herself and Timmy from the table
Hippolyta slams on the spoon, sending Timmy flying
155121211.content:
Philippus: https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/wond...
Artemis of Bana-Mighdall: https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/wond...
Nubia: https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/marv...
Areto: https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/marv...
Castalia: https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/marv...

"My Queen?"

Hippolyta's eyes fluttered open, drawn from her afternoon slumber by the gentle voice. The queen of the Amazons slowly sat up in her bed, rubbed her eyes, and turned to the owner of the voice which woke her up. It was a familiar dark-skinned woman, her pitch-black hair tied up in little braids, garbed in the finest Amazonian armor ever crafted by the blacksmith, Io.

"Phillipus," Hippolyta acknowledged her lover. "Forgive me, I must have drifted deep in sleep. What time of the day is it?"

"Apollo's sun has fallen to the east, my Queen, and the members of the high council have only barely arrived," Phillipus informed the queen.

"The high council?" Hippolyta mumbled. She looked out to the horizon as the last glimmer of sunlight dimmed into darkness, turned her gaze to the birdcage set atop her nightstand, and suddenly remembered her plans for the night. "Oh yes, of course, it is nearly time for our dinner, I have nearly forgotten. Please inform the high council that I will be with them in a moment."

"At once, my Queen," Phillipus said, bowing deeply before turning on her heel and marching out.

Hippolyta turned her attention to the birdcage on the nightstand, peeking at the tiny form of her newly adopted charge sleeping soundly inside. Timmy's sheets rose and dipped underneath the sheets with every little breath. Quietly, Hippolyta opened the cage's door and gently massaged her finger onto Timmy's shrunken form, shaking him awake. "Timmy? Wake up, child, it is time for dinner."

The shaking managed to wake Timmy up, his mind clouded by the sudden awakening from his sleep. The shrunken eight year-old boy yawned, stretched, and then slumped his was onto the giantess's awaiting palm. Hippolyta lifted him up to his shoulder and tucked him underneath the shoulder strap of her gown, securing the tired tiny boy between the cloth and her skin. She smiled at Timmy's tiny frame, who returned her smile in kindness, shifted her hair to hide his form, and ventured out to another chamber of the palace where she would meet the members of Themyscira's high council.

Hippolyta eventually arrived at the chamber, a round wooden table set with platters and golden goblets filled with wine, loaded with dishes among dishes of different foods, mostly consisting of meats, breads, fruits, and vegetables. Phillipus and Artemis, being two members of the High Council of Themyscira, were already seated, along with a few others: Nubia, another dark-skinned Amazon with shorter, dark hair, dressed in Amazonian armor; Castalia, a slightly tan and slightly older Amazon who wore a cloak around her head, concealing her hair color; and Areto, yet another dark-skinned Amazon, similar in age and grace as Hippolyta, her dark hair tied in braids, fixed into a bun.

“My Queen,” came the collected chorus of Amazons acknowledging the presence of their monarch.

“My sisters,” Hippolyta greeted. “Please forgive my tardiness, I have retired to my chambers and lost track of time.”

"Phillipus has already informed us about your retirement, my Queen," Areto said. "The reason why someone as able as you retiring from their own throne is a mystery."

"Then, my sisters, allow me to explain in full," Hippolyta said as she sat down, helping herself to the dinner on the table. "Earlier this day, a flying vessel from Man's World was struck by the gods' protective wards and crashed into the waters not more than two miles from our shores. As far as we know, there were no survivors in the wreckage... at least, that is what I had assumed as well until I came across a child who washed up on the shores, alone and orphaned."

The members of the High Council of Themyscira murmured amongst themselves, worriedly while Hippolyta continued. "The child is a son of Man's World who suffered this great tragedy more than any of you have ever known. He has no family that he knows of beyond our borders, no one to take him in, so I have allowed him to stay with me in exchange that I bound his servitude to me in accordance to Aphrodite's Law."

"My Queen!" Areto gasped.

"Surely, you cannot be serious, Hippolyta!" Nubia argued. "Men have failed to uphold their bondage with their Amazon mistresses in the past! Even if he is a child, you cannot expect him to serve you hand and foot for the comforts of our home!"

"Bite your tongue, Nubia! The Queen and the boy have already established the bond out of their free will!" Phillipus barked back, standing up from her seat in fury. "We cannot defy the laws passed down from Aphrodite now! The boy now swears his loyalty to her until he is released from his bondage by death or by the Queen's own volition!"

"If the boy really has sworn his loyalty to the Queen, then he must stay by her side at all times as the law clearly states," Castalia pointed out, having wisdom of the law herself. "And even if he did survive the terrible crash which has claimed the poor souls onboard that vessel to Hades, bless them, the boy must have found a method to bypass the sharks without ending up in their bellies."

"If this is the case, then where is this boy you speak of, Hippolyta?" Areto questioned her Queen.

Hippolyta sighed as she reached for her shoulder where she deliberately obscured her shrunken charge from sight. She gently pulled him from underneath the straps, out of her silky ebony hair, and held her out for the High Council members to see. They immediately gasped in shock as they gathered around their Queen's outreached hand, questioning the tiny boy's stature while he took cover behind his adopted mother's massive fingers from their sudden movements.

"This is Timmy Walker, the survivor of the demise that claimed his family and everyone else aboard the flying vessel," Hippolyta introduced her charge to the High Council. "He has been shrunken down by the effects of the magical wards as he and his family flew through the storm. Somehow, he was able to escape this fate and the bellies of our sharks before he ended up on our shores. There was no way I could allow a child to suffer with no family and no one to comfort and care for him."

Hippolyta tilted her hand downwards, and Timmy took it as a gesture to walk off the edge of her fingers and onto the table. Hippolyta broke off a small piece of meat big enough to fill her tiny charge's belly with ease and handed it to him. Timmy unquestionably took it from her graciously and sat down on the handle of the spoon placed next to the Queen's dishes, listening in on the conversations between him and his giant caretaker.

Nubia scoffed. "Look at our Queen. She takes in a shrunken son as her pet and feeds him like one too. I bet she already made him a glorified bed to suit his size in a glorified birdcage."

"Cease this prattle, Nubia, we cannot go back on Aphrodite's Law now," Castalia snipped, turning to the boy, "but I am curious as to how you managed to make it to our shores without being swallowed by the sea and its sharks."

The rest of the Amazons present turned their eyes to Timmy as well, making him shudder and hug his piece of meat against him like a Teddy bear. Hippolyta brought her hand behind him, cushioning his back with her palm's warm flesh, gently caressing his back with her thumb. Timmy looked at the giant queen's face and beheld her maternal gentleness and her reassuring smile. “Well, child? Is there anything you can tell us about how you managed to reach the shores despite the odds being against you?”

Timmy gulped nervously, shuddering as he recollected the last moments before he went into unconsciousness. "I was... I was sucked out of the plane's window... and I fell into the sea..." he recounted meekly, shivering as he remembered the frigid temperature of the sea. "Then I tried to swim, but the waves brought me underwater. I tried to swim back up, but I kept getting pulled under. I tried, and I tried, and I tried, and then I became so tired, and I got sleepy... and then..."

Timmy then remembered the last significant detail of what happened as he went into unconsciousness. "I saw this lady in the water. I didn't see her face, but she was swimming towards me. Then I heard this woman tell me that it wasn't my time yet," he said, the Amazons above turning to each other with a collected range of mixed emotions, from shock and awe, to disbelief and worry. "Then I fell asleep and when I woke up, I was on the beach."

"It cannot be..." Areto gasped.

"But it is," Castalia answered. "This child was delivered to us by the hand of Thetis, the daughter of Poseidon."

"But this cannot be!" Nubia grumbled, shooting to her feet. "The boy is a son of Man's World, and not our daughter! In the past, Thetis has delivered daughters who have fallen in the sea to us, and only when she senses that the child is special! The boy is a son of Man's World, not our daughter! He cannot be one of us! He does not belong here!"

"That is enough, Nubia!" Hippolyta barked, slamming her hand on the table, silencing the Amazons. "Thetis would not have delivered my charge to these shores if she did not sense something special about him! To deny her will means to go against our nature as protectors and nurturers of our children, and I will never go against our nature!"

What happens next?
155121211.title: Dinner with the Amazon High Council

choices: Rerouting to "A Test From the Goddesses!"
Rerouting to "A Kid Napping During a Kidnapping!"
1551212111.content:
Hippolyta heard a little whimper at her placement at the table. When she looked, she saw little Timmy ducked away from her silverware, cowering frightfully. The Queen of the Amazons pieced together the reason for Timmy's sudden fear of her, and she sighed stressfully at it. Apparently, when she slammed her hand on her silverware outraged by Nubia's defiance, the hand slammed on the spoon Timmy was on but he managed to jump away before either her gigantic hand crushed him or he was launched by the handle.

With a pitied look, Hippolyta quietly begged the scared shrunken boy to her hand, and Timmy reluctantly obeyed her. Guided by her other hand, Hippolyta gently scooped Timmy into her hands and gently shushed him while she ran her finger down his back to comfort the sobbing boy. "Shh, Timmy, don't be afraid. I am sorry I almost hurt you, Timmy. I am sorry."

Hippolyta cradled her charge to her breast and allowed Timmy to release his fear through his sobbing. She turned to her fellow members of the Amazon high council with a disappointed glance and sighed. "It seems I've made a mistake introducing my charge to the council. I had high hopes that adopting the son of Man's World as my charge would ease your fear of men, but it seems your fear and resentment has clouded your judgment towards their young sons, even ones who has suffered so much like my charge."

Hippolyta gently secured Timmy onto her shoulder, underneath the straps of her fuchsia toga. The tiny boy quickly held onto her neck for security and comfort while the Queen hid his form with her hair and stood up from her seat. "Until you have shed your resentment towards Man's World and their sons, I will be taking my meal in my chambers. Only when you have deemed yourself worthy of my forgiveness will I return to this table."

Hippolyta took her plate and her adopted son, and moved to her chambers. While on the way, she heard a tiny youthful sob within the entanglement of her raven black hair. She gently moved them away and saw Timmy sniffling against her neck, feeling his tears soak only a tiny fraction of her skin.

"What is wrong, young Timmy?" Hippolyta inquired, a pitied frown drooping on her beautiful visage.

"I'm sorry," the tiny boy said, wiping his nose. "I'm sorry I ruined your dinner, your majesty."

"Oh, Timmy, don't carry the blame of this incident on your shoulders," Hippoltya said, gently reaching her shoulder to comfort her shrunken charge perched on it. "If anything, I am to blame for this. I should have known that the members of the council was not ready for you, yet you brought your fears to light before and I have not taken them seriously."

"But why?" Timmy asked, sobbing. "Why don't you and those ladies want me here? Did I do something wrong?"

"No, Timmy you did nothing wrong," Hippolyta hastily answered. "The Amazons has trust issues concerning men in the outside world."

"But why?"

Hippolyta came to a large vase in the hallway, decorated with images of people that were only in the vases of ancient Greek legends today. "Timmy, you may be young, but I believe you deserve the answers you seek," the giant queen said, running her hand along the etchings on the vase. "In an ancient past, many thousands of years ago, the Amazons were born from the soils of the Earth with the souls of ancient women slain by the men. I was the first Amazon born, and I have led my fellow sisters to build the city of Themyscira in Anatolia where the gods blessed us with many wondrous gifts, and we became warriors of peace for a time.

"But one day, the vengeful God of War, Ares, sought to destroy us by sending the demi-god Heracles to our home," Hippolyta continued, her tone, Timmy noticed, dropping darkly. "Attempts for peaceful negotiations failed when Heracles and his men attacked us, captured us, and caged us like animals. He and his men took advantage of me, of my sisters, in a bad way. We fought back, and as penance, the gods sent us to this island to guard an unspeakable evil which rests beneath our feet. We built a home here and renamed it Themyscira after our fallen city, and we have lived peacefully away from the World of Men for thousands of years since."

"I'm sorry that happened to you, your majesty," Timmy said, leaning against the Queen's neck.

"Thank you for your sympathy, child, but such feelings were not common back then," Hippolyta said. "Even now, my sisters cannot forget the scars Heracles and his men inflicted on us. Over time, such distrust has trickled down to sons your age. We Amazons have taught the ways of peace and love to our children, and to see them go back on their teachings on the children of men is hypocrisy. I cannot stand for anyone who would want to drive away the children of men for what their fathers and their forefathers did to us."

"But I never did anything to them," Timmy spoke up. "It's just not fair."

"And that is why I cannot bear to let anyone, even my own sisters, berate the sons of Man's World," Hippolyta affirmed. "To speak out against my decision to take you in under your servitude to me is a forgivable sin, but to judge someone's worth for being born a boy is another story entirely. I had hoped by helping raise Diana, she would be more lenient towards children as a whole."

"Who's Diana?" Timmy asked.

"She is my daughter, born from the clay of this island and gifted at birth with the gods' strengths," Hippolyta answered, a proud, motherly smile suddenly creeping on her face. "She went out to Men's World to return a man who landed on this island years ago. She's become a champion of justice and peace and known throughout the world."

"I don't think I know who that is, your majesty," Timmy said.

"Yes, you do," the proud giantess said, casting a sideways smile to her son. "You and the whole world knows her as Wonder Woman."

At this, Timmy gasped, and all sadness he felt before was replaced with gladness. "Really!? You're Wonder Woman's mommy!?" he practically screeched, much to the amusement of the queen. "I didn't know you're her mommy! Wait a minute, if you're like my mommy now, does that mean that Diana's my big sister!?"

"In a matter of speaking, yes," the Queen of the Amazons softly answered, stifling a chuckle at Timmy's excited reaction.

"Yay! I have a big sister who's a superhero, and a mommy who's that superhero's mommy!" Timmy screamed from the top of his lungs, all sense of grammar lost in the excitement. He nearly lost his balance when he threw his hands up excitingly, but Hippolyta quickly caught him before he fell of her shoulder.

"Slow down, Timmy. I don't want you to hurt yourself," Hippolyta advised, no longer holding in her amused chuckles.

Timmy quickly readjusted his security on the queen's shoulder and calmed down with a sigh. "You're majesty, will you ever introduce me to Wonder Woman? I always dreamed of meeting a superhero, but I never thought you'd be Wonder Woman's mommy."

"Of course, child, but Diana always returns when she is needed or when she feels the need to return home," Hippolyta answered. "I imagine my adoption of you will come to her as a shock, but Diana is a gentle soul. She has a tender heart and always inspires the good in children your age. She will come to adore you as her little brother, I am sure of it."

Timmy immediately clutched the side of Hippolyta's face, hugging her cheek in a grateful, lovingly embrace, much to her surprise. "Thank you, your majesty. I was sad when I lost my mommy, and I was scared when I was shrunken down, but at least you were kind to me."

Hippolyta smiled. She pulled Timmy from his secure perch on her shoulder, held him in her open palm, and brought him up to her pursed lips where she planted a motherly kiss on his body, the same kiss she used with Diana when she was younger. "You are very welcome, Timmy. And if it pleases you, young one, you may call me 'mother' or anything similar. You are my charge, after all, and I want to love you as a mother would love her son."

Timmy smiled, sitting innocently in the palm of the royal giantess's palm. "Okay, mama."

Hippolyta secured Timmy onto her shoulder and returned to her chambers. She felt a familiar sense of warmth inside her heart, like she was watching Diana when she was just a spirited child. Timmy had his family and his size taken from him while he was still young and innocent, but Hippolyta was willing to guide the child along his journey into a brave young man.

She promised she wouldn't replace Timmy's real mother, but she'd pick up where she left off, and that was her goal for the years to come.

What happens next?

1.) Hippolyta and Timmy retire in her chambers for the evening; the next morning, Timmy begins his servitude.
2.) Hippolyta and Timmy retire in her chambers for the evening; she tells Timmy of the gods who watch over the island.
3.) Hippolyta and Timmy retire in her chambers for the evening; a shadowy figure watches and waits for them to fall asleep.
1551212111.title: Hippolyta's Excuse to Leave

choices: The Amazons March On Without Him
1551214.content:
On Themyscira, legions of Amazon soldiers would be sent to patrol the shores for any intruder or potential threat that dared invade their paradise. This particular legion, led by the Amazon's general, Phillipus, and their strongest warrior, Artemis of Bana-Mighdall, was ordered by Queen Hippolyta herself to patrol the shores in lieu of a recent event happening just a mile away from their shores within the mystic barriers. Their main priority was to search the perimeter of the island for any survivors who could possibly have bypassed the guarding megalodons and made it to shore.

As per Aphrodite's Law, men were not allowed to set foot on the village, and this extended to male children as well, except for certain men who were permitted to enter the island by the Queen herself. Nonetheless, since Aphrodite's Law also governs the Amazons' lives through love, then they must accommodate them in their own fashion. The men would be taken to recover in the dungeons, while the women would recover in an Amazon's home. This was how it was on Paradise Island, and it was the soldiers' job to enforce this law unless the Queen has granted an exception under certain conditions.

While Timmy had wept, he picked up the hearing of someone striding the sands, accompanied by the slight tremors with each stride. Timmy broke away from his mourning and turned to the direction of the sound. The people were a group of armored giant women, all of them dressed in leather breastplates and metal bracelets on their wrists reaching just below her forearms. Around their waists, they all wore a belt with a scabbard sheathed with a sword, holding up a short beige skirt, and knee-high leather gladiator sandals worn on their feet. They were also armed, holding a large spear in one hand, a shield in the other, and a vigilant look on their faces.

Timmy almost whimpered as the lead soldier, a giant black woman, marched towards his location. Her sandaled foot raised in the air to take another step, completely unaware that the tiny little boy was underneath its leather sole. The boy whimpered, curled up into a tight little ball, and cried right as the dark-skinned giantess planted her foot on top of its spot. Timmy tensed up, like he was expecting that moment when he would be squashed under the giant's foot like a little bug, but opened his eyes to face a set of five giant chocolate-colored toes inches away from his face. His eyes turned upwards towards the colossal figure of the woman who nearly squished him, looking and pointing out at the sea.

"There, as the Queen said it would be," the ebony giantess leading the giant troop of female soldiers said, literally and figuratively pointing at the black smoke in the distant horizon. "The aircraft has crashed a mile away from the shores, meaning there is a chance that a survivor may have swam to these shores along this side."

"This is a waste of our time,” addressed the redheaded giantess, Artemis of the Bana-Mighdall. “I have seen footages of airplanes in different parts of Man's World crashing before, and no one survives a crash like this. Even if someone did, there is no way they would make it to these shores without invoking the megalodon's hungry wrath."

The leading armored black woman and turned to the impatient Amazon. “Be still your tongue and your impatience, Artemis,” General Phillipus ordered firmly. “Our orders are to bring in any survivor who has made it to these shores. Remember, there are men in this world who have survived greater disasters, including those who have crashed into our waters in similar crafts. Who is to say that anyone could have survived that disaster and has gone unnoticed by our megalodons?"

Artemis scoffed. "If it is so, then why do we not see any bodies in the water, or tracks leading from the waters and onto the shores?"

"There is no clear explanation for that yet, Artemis," Phillipus affirmed, turning towards her sister-in-arms. Unbeknownst to her, however, the simple act of shuffling her feet to face the redheaded warrior nearly caused her to step on Timmy at her feet down below. "However, our bickering is only ensuring a step away from discovering any survivors, which goes against the Queen's orders. So unless you have anything else to add, I suggest we continue along the shoreline and search the areas between here and the city."

While the legion of armored giantesses argued amongst themselves, Timmy watched and listened to it all down at their toes. He didn’t understand what the giantesses would do to him if they ever found him, but it frightened him as much as the Brobdingnagian size difference between them did. His close call with the black giantess's foot nearly ground him into a little bloody smear in the sand. If that was only because they weren't aware of his presence at their feet, then he dreaded to think of what would happen to him if they were aware. They could easily stamp on him, press him underneath their rear ends, or even swallow him whole! Timmy shuddered at the thought, but he shook it away and quickly thought of what to do next.

1.) Timmy runs and hides from the giant Amazon soldiers in fear for their potentially harmful treatment.
2.) Timmy screams, jumps, and waves at the giantesses to grab their attention. Maybe they could help him!
3.) Timmy grabs one of the giantess's sandals by the straps and hitches a dangerous ride at their feet.
4.) Before Timmy could do anything, one of the Amazons spots him at their feet.
5.) Before Timmy could do anything, the Amazons march away, leaving Timmy alone.
1551214.title: A Group of Amazon Soldiers

15512143.content:
Timmy was unsure of himself about this decision, but he figured that this was the only way he could get to the queen of Themyscira. Without them spotting, the tiny boy made his way to the nearest pair of feet with leather sandals firmly strapped to them.

The fierce redhead Amazon, Artemis was the closest one that Timmy could get to. At the moment, she was too busy bickering with the ebony giantess, Phillipus to even notice that a tiny son of Man's World was scuttling towards her heels. Timmy managed to reach the left foot of one of Themyscira's most formidable warriors without them noticing. Her sole emanated a certain scent of sweat mixed with something more pleasurable, the smell of a tropical fruit salad mixed with coconut.

She must take special care of her feet while in the shower, Timmy figured.

"Squadron! Move out!" Phillipus barked.

Timmy's timing couldn't have been more impeccable, because the moment the black giantess ordered the troops to move out, the tiny boy managed to get a tight hold of Artemis's sandal straps at the side of her smaller toes. He barely made the time when Artemis’s left foot rose up and fell in a march. Each rise and fall was as scary as the last. It was like holding on the side of a roller coaster in motion. Timmy screamed each time he rose and fell, with his hands on the straps being the only harness restraint on this crazy ride.

Artemis's footfalls boomed in the sand, spraying him with arising dust. After one certain turn to the right, Artemis unknowingly flung the one-inch boy with her foot. The fling loosened Timmy's grip on the sandal straps, so when the boy tried to reclaim his hold, his grip loosened further. While he did, Artemis's foot sunk into a small hill of sand, submerging the boy as quickly as he emerged with the rising foot. Except this time, he didn't stay harnessed against the strap, he was sliding with the sand into the sandal.

Timmy screamed as he slid down that leathery slope for only a second until he was wedged underneath the giantess's sole, pinned underneath the warm flesh in between two giant feminine toes. With it, Timmy was held tight between two of Artemis’s goes and forcibly, unknowingly, and unwillingly carried along for the rough ride.

The smell of fruit and coconut was stronger here. The power of Artemis’s toes clenched the boy between the big toe and the index toe. Timmy screamed as he was subjected to an intensely scary front row seat to the rise and fall of Artemis’s foot without anything else to safely strap himself in. The toes loosened slightly with every rise and then they clenched tightly with every fall. The impact knocked Timmy around a little, enough to disorient him and give him a dizzying headache.

Of course, Timmy wasn’t the only one who felt he was knocking around with each footfall. Not long after her debate with Phillipus, Artemis was only several steps into the March when she felt something irritating her left foot. With each step, she felt something in between two of her clenching toes and opted to do something about it. She decided to wriggle her toes, manipulate her digits to push away the tiny obstruction between her foot and her sandal.

Unbeknownst to her, she made a one-inch young boy suffer through it all. The tiny eight year old screamed as suddenly, midway throughout the walk from hell, the giantess wriggled her toes on top of him. The two toes that trapped him smothered Timmy’s tiny body underneath the powerful digits. The five titanic toes squished him against the sandal’s flat. With each little wriggle, Timmy ended up getting squishing him further and further down and deeper underneath the soft and scented sole. Out of desperation, the crying tiny boy beat against the skin of the foot and bit right into it.

Artemis suddenly grunted at the sharp pain underneath her foot. Perhaps she accidentally picked up a biting ant in her sandal? She wriggled the ball of her foot and pressed it harder against the obstruction in her sandal. It was really wriggling underneath her foot. It felt rather nice, if Artemis was being honest with herself, but it was getting in the way of her march. She stopped her march to loosen up her foot from her sandal and tapped the toe section to force the little bug out.

Sending her discomfort, Philippus halted her company and turned to the high-ranking red-haired Amazon foolishly staying behind just to adjust her foot.

“There had better be a reason for you to be falling out of rank, Artemis,” the general addressed her, to which Artemis replied...

1.) “There is something in my shoe. I need to check it out.” (Artemis lifts her shoe and dumps the "bug" into her hand, revealing to be the tiny and traumatized Timmy.)

2.) “There is something in my shoe. But it’s nothing, I’m sure.” (Artemis doesn't check her shoe and she marches with her squadron, not realizing that Timmy is forced to endure a long march.)
15512143.title: Traveling the Island by Foot

choices: Bailing From Being Brought Before the Queen
155121431.content:
“There is something in my shoe. I need to check it out.”

The fierce and suspicious Artemis lifted her foot up and held it sideways. By squeezing the leather sandal, Artemis was able to create an opening between the flat and the underside of her foot so the little bug that bit her would roll out and into her open palm.

Timmy, on the other hand, recently experienced neck-breaking vertigo when Artemis tapped her toe section, trying to force him out from under her foot. Thanks to the soft yet firm hold of Artemis’s foot skin, the tiny eight year-old was kept from being thrown out into the sand and possibly stomped on by the giantess. In the midst of being battered, bruised, and disoriented by the ignorant giantess’s feet, Timmy felt the urge to puke from the intense dizziness. Even that didn’t stop him from feeling everything rise up and turn on its side. All of a sudden, the squeezing pressure between her foot and the sandal suddenly gaped open as Timmy felt himself sliding backwards then rolling from underneath the ball, the overbearing toes, and then into the soft, calloused hand of the giantess who unknowingly tormented him.

Timmy coughed and sputtered as the palm he crouched on was lifted to the level of the stern green eyes of the fierce Amazonian warrior. As soon as the tiny boy looked into those giant, seemingly hostile eyes, the boy screamed and curled in a fetal position, turning away from Artemis’s gaze.

“Please don’t hurt me!” Timmy cried as the other gigantic Amazonian soldiers marched up to him and Artemis.

“Artemis, what is that in your hand?” Philippus demanded to know.

“Apparently, I found one of the survivors of the fallen flying vessel, but he is nothing more now than a bug that found its way into my shoe,” Artemis answered, holding the scared one-inch boy out to Philippus and the other Amazons to see.

“This is an unusual development,” the blonde Amazon, Persephone said. “All children shouldn’t be so small, they’d have to fit inside an Amazon’s shoe.”

“If he truly is the son of Man’s World, then we must report him to the queen at once,” Philippus reminded her troops about the mission. She then extended her palm to the red-haired Amazon. “Artemis, please give him to me so we can ensure him safe escort. Being trapped under your foot seems to have scared him to death.”

Artemis didn’t hesitate to answer. “As you wish,” she said, dumping the suddenly surprised boy into Philippus’s awaiting hand, “but only because I don’t want him biting any part of my body again.”

Timmy tumbled around the darker giantess’s palm, barely having any time to get up as she gently curled her fingers and trapped him in her fist. “Forgive me, child, but the queen has ordered us to take you to her personally,” Philippus said, reaching for a small drawstring sack on her belt, “and this is the only way for me to safely escort you.”

Philippus moves the boy between her fingers, pinched his shirt between three of her fingers and her thumb, and dangled him over the opening of the sack. Timmy screamed and wriggled in the grip as the giant chocolate digits held him over the yawning abyss of the sack’s opening; he was terrified of the dark. The screams got louder as Philippus powered him down into the opening.

“NOOOO!!! Please don’t put in there! I’ll be good, I promise, just don’t put me in there!”

But Philippus didn’t listen. She gently inserted the tiny screaming boy into the sack, and by loosening her fingers, she felt the boy fall to the bottom. She then drew the drawstring close and tight, leaving the opening slightly ajar to let in air for her bite-sized prisoner. With a simple command, Philippus and her troops marched for the queen’s palace in the city.

Within the sack on Philippus’s thigh, Timmy was once again subjected to motions of a giantess’s march. It wasn’t as bad as getting trapped underneath Artemis’s scented feet in her sandal, but he was still getting motion sickness from this experience. What’s worse is that now that he was discovered, he’d be taken to the queen. She would probably keep him for a slave or a toy for torment! She’d lock him in a cage somewhere dark and damp with very little light to reach him. At the very least, she’d send him back to Man’s World with nothing and no one to look after him. Whatever the queen decided, it would change his very life.

What happened next?

1.) Timmy stays in the sack and is brought before Queen Hippolyta. She will decide Timmy's destiny.
2.) Timmy is afraid of what will happen, so he rips a hole in the sack and escapes.
155121431.title: Found Under Foot

choices: Returning Home as Wonder Woman's Son
Returning Home as Another Amazon's Son
1551214311.content:
Timmy decided to stay in the sack and await his fate. The opening of the drawstring sack was too high and too steep to reach, and the movements of his gigantic captor was making staying in one place difficult. Even if he did attempt an escape, Timmy would most likely be spotted by the giant Amazons and quickly be recaptured. As best as he could, he curled up in the bottom of the savor and felt the motions of Philippus’s thigh rock him gently.

When at last, after his giant captor finally stopped did Timmy feel a primal fear lodge in his throat. The small legion of giantesses finally made it into the palace. Timmy could only curl up and listen as the dark-skinned addressed the high royalty outside the sack.

“My queen, we have found and brought the son of Man’s World to you, as you ordered,” Philippus reported to Queen Hippolyta, ruler of the Amazons.

“You have brought me news of your capture, general, yet I do not see him with you,” Queen Hippolyta observed. “Tell me, where have you taken the son of Man’s World when I have specifically ordered you to bring him to me directly?”

“My Queen, there has been an... unexpected development.” Timmy flinched as daylight broke into the bag the same instance the drawstring was loosened. He barely had time to adjust to the brightness, but from the light, a giant ebony hand with five imposing fingers curled up around him, enveloping him all around in soft flesh. Then he felt the hand lift him out of the confines of the sack, turn him over onto her palm, and felt the fingers loosen and spread out, revealing him to the outside world... to the regal, brunette giantess staring down at him from the throne with a bewildered look.

“This is indeed unexpected,” Hippolyta concurred. “I would never expect a child from Man’s World to be small.”

“He was like this when we found him, highness,” Philippus reported. “He was like this battered and terrified after he endured much torment when he slipped inside of Artemis’s shoe.”

Philippus turned her gaze to Artemis, who stood at attention and bowed her head. “I beg your forgiveness, your highness. I nearly mistook him for a bug under my foot.”

“There is no need to apologize for what you have done, Artemis. I, too, would not have known this child from a bug if it had slipped into my shoe,” Hippolyta said as she descended from her throne, turning to the tiny eight year-old shuddering in the palm of her general.

“And now for the matter at hand, so to speak,” Hippolyta addressed, approaching the fearful boy. You are a lost child, are you not? You are lost and terrified because the cruel hand of fate has shrunken you, hasn’t it? There is no reason for you to fear because I promise no harm may come to youwhile under my charge. Do you understand, child?”

Timmy nodded, whimpering.

“Good. Now then, can you please tell me your name?” Hippolyta asked as though she was addressing her daughter when she was the boy’s age.

“T-Timmy, your majesty. T-Timmy Walker,” the bite-sized boy answered.

“It is a pleasure to make your acquaintance, Timmy Walker. I am Hippolyta, queen of the Amazons and ruler of Themyscira,” the queen introduced herself. Hippolyta held her hand out, and Philippus gently ramped her hand to nudge Timmy to walk onto the awaiting palm. “Can you tell me where you are from and how you came to be this way?”

Timmy sniffled and stifled the urge to cry. “I-I’m from Florida, your majesty. I-I was flying with my family over the ocean to Italy when... when... when a scary storm hit the plane! I don’t know what happened, but I shrunk to this size and I was sucked out of the plane! I fell into the water and I tried to swim but I was so tired, I couldn’t swim anymore! Then I woke up on the beach all alone and... and...”

Timmy couldn’t hold back the urge to cry as he buried his face in his hands. “They’re gone! They’re gone and I can never see them again! I’ll never see my big brothers again! I’ll never see my daddy again! I’ll never see my mommy again!”

While Timmy wept in the queen’s hand, keeling over letting tears flow from his eyes, Hippolyta couldn’t help but feel pity for the poor boy. With her other hand, she gently stroked Timmy’s back like a lost bird trapped in the rain and in need of shelter. “I am sorry, little one. This is a fate you did not deserve to suffer from. I can never imagine the pain of your loss and the terror of being so small compared to the rest of the world.”

Timmy sniffled and choked. “I miss them so much!”

"And I'm sure you do, child. I am so sorry..." Hippolyta gently stroked Timmy's back, comforting him while his tears flowed like the waterfalls at the edge of the island. She cast her pitied gaze to her guards, Philippus seemingly impassive, but Artemis eyeing the boy sternly, but softer. "This is a hard decision for myself, for us all. For as long as we lived, we have taken in daughters from Man's World who have survived Poseidon's waters and cared for them, but not sons. Because of our laws, we have never allowed man to set foot on our island, but they have been passive to their young when their needs were greater."

"So what is your decision, my Queen?" Artemis questioned. "Are you willing to take in a child in greater need, or are you willing to abide by our rules and send him back to Man's World?"

"Certainly not by himself," Philippus countered. "The boy is an orphan, and he needs a mother more than anything else. One of us should take him in and bound him to us by Aphrodite's Law so he may stay among us as one of our own and not fear incurring the wrath of the gods. If not, then one of us should have the arduous task of taking him back to Man's World as his sole guardian."

Hippolyta slumped forward in deep contemplation. She held the boy in cupped hands, and he could see his tiny face etched in teary sadness. It broke her heart to see a child so broken by the death of his family, shrunken by the force of the gods' barrier around the island, and crushed under the feet of her guards. Young Timmy Walker needed someone to take him in, to love him and raise him, and Hippolyta knew who would do the job right.

“I have made my decision...” she addressed everyone in the room. “From this day forth, young Timmy Walker of Florida..."

1.) "...shall be allowed to stay on the shores of Themyscira under my own guardianship and protection." (Hippolyta takes in Timmy.)
2.) "...shall be allowed to stay on the shores of Themyscira under the guardianship and protection from one of our own." (Hippolyta tasks one of the other Amaozns to take him in.)
3.) "...cannot remain on the shores of Themyscira, which is why I will volunteer my daughter to return with him to Man's World as his guardian." (Hippolyta tasks Wonder Woman to return with Timmy to Man's World as his adoptive mother.)
4.) "...cannot remain on the shores of Themyscira, which is why I will volunteer myself to return with him to Man's World as his guardian." (Hippolyta returns with Timmy to Man's World as his adoptive mother.)
5.) "...cannot remain on the shores of Themyscira, which is why I will volunteer one of the other Amazons to return with him to Man's World as his guardian." (Hippolyta tasks one of the other Amazons with Timmy to Man's World as his adoptive mother.)
1551214311.title: Brought Before the Queen

15512143111.content:
“From this day forth, young Timmy Walker of Florida shall be allowed to stay on the shores of Themyscira under my own guardianship and protection,” Hippolyta decreed to her guards. They, and the tiny boy in her palm turned to her with collected shock.

“But your highness, you cannot possibly mean this!” Philippus immediately protested. “This is a direct violation of Aphrodite’s Law! If you allow the son of man to walk on the same ground as the Amazons, then you will bring the wrath of the gods down upon us!”

"True, but any man who sets foot on this island is to be confined and imprisoned immediately under the watchful eye of the Amazons,” Hippolyta explained, holding out Timmy sitting in her cupped palms. "Besides, the child is young and small, hardly posing any threat to anyone. With no one else to watch over him, we Amazons must perform our duties to nurture and encourage the growth of our children, even if they are a man or an Amazon. Therefore, I appoint myself to the protection and welfare for this child.”

“But your majesty...”

“That is enough, Philippus,” Hippolyta interjected, raising her hand. “I have made my decision. I will be in my chambers to accommodate and this child personally teach him the ways of our people. You have served me well in bringing the boy here to me, though under abnormal circumstances. You may return to your duties.”

“Yes, your majesty,” Philippus said, bowing her head. She and her fellow Amazonian soldiers marched out of the throne room, Artemis being the last one to stay behind and give Timmy a sideways glare. Timmy retreated behind the queen’s monolithic fingers, but he was immediately comforted by another set of giant fingers resting on top of his back. With it, Artemis turned and marched out of the throne room.

“The woman with the red hair is scary,” Timmy said meekly, making a Hippolyta chuckle.

“It is natural that she is intimidating. After all, she’s the fiercest warrior among us now,” she said, gently stroking her new charge’s back as she walked back to her chambers. “Now, Timmy, I want you to understand that as long as you are here, you are to become my personal servant and pet bound to me by law. I cannot guarantee that the tasks before you will be easy, but you must prove you are worthy of being under my charge to my sisters. Otherwise, by law, you will be forced off the island by way of the sea.”

The very thought of drifting back in that dangerous, turbulent sea made Timmy’s blood freeze. “No! I’ll be good, your majesty! I’ll do my best to do whatever you want!”
